review_content: 12 ounce can. Mild aroma and disappearing head. Refreshing crisp mouth feel and mild malt taste with mild hop balance. Good thirst quencher! Prosit!
Found out of bottle from a friend.  Pous a faint hazy yellow with quick foam. Very nuch a summer beer. Light and refreshing. More for quantities on a hot day.
Jeden z nejlepších kolschu které jsem kdy ochutnal. Ale chápu že mnozí Američané toto neocení. Plechovkove zakoupené na internetovém obchodu americanbeer.cz

Can poured into a shaker glass. Straw yellow with a small, fizzy white head. Aroma is malty and sweet. Initial taste is clean, crisp, sweet. High carbonation and a light body. It's inoffensive but rather nondescript. Yay summer...?
Light amber pour. Very bready and yeasty aroma and flavor. Rather chewy for this style. Not bad but not very typical. Can.

basically  a macro kolsch - flabby and sweet-not much definition-hop bitterness but not much flavor-heavier cloying palate---aroma ok - doughy and crackery, caramel - earthy hops, old leaves. flavor = bread dough, old wood, malt syrup, apple seeds - muddy hops, lightly bitter -- palate is a heavy wash of a cheap mix of ingredients like i made beer in my bathtub with bran flakes and pine needles (slight exaggeration?) - not a good kolsch though
Pours amber with a thin white head. Aroma of weak bread malt. Taste has bread notes, amber malt with some herbal hints. Palate has floral hops, lingering sweetness. Interesting.
Bottle into tall glass. Looks a touch amber for a true kolsch. Thin head. Bready aroma and taste. Malt dominant. Grains and mild hop. Decent beer but not a typical kolsch
Light crisp clean fruit flavor with bitter finish.  I am surprised that this is a German style based beer.  The German beers I have had are more robust with stronger personality.

On tap. Pours a clear golden color with a fair head. Aroma of citrus, light malt sweetness and grain. Taste of citrus, grain with a trace of malt sweetness. Some bitterness and a clean finish. Fairly light body, crisp, clean and refreshing. Nice summertime offering.
Clear light gold pour with a white head.  The aroma has light grain and earthy notes.  It has a light crisp body with lively carbonation.  The taste is mildly bitter and refreshing.
Not bad.  Nice for a summer brew.  Light and crisp with a bit of hops at the end.  Recommend for a hot summer day by the pool.

Bottle. Pours a crystal clear light gold color with a small fizzy white head and poor retention. No lacing. Crisp, pilsner-like mouthfeel. Tastes like a pilsner too, except less sharp and more bread in the finish. Decent.

No aroma but did expect any or much. White head that disappeared instantly. Clean crisp flavor that I expect from a Kölsch. Deep yellow color which is nice. Medium mouth feel. Low bitterness and nice low hop flavor and hop finish. Much like my Kölsch. Really liked it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great beer to drink in the summertime if you're looking for a refreshing break in the heat

Great summer time beer, very smooth and the taste is exceptional. Would definitely have at a summer BBQ. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not a great beer, but its a solid summer brew. Lemon and grass and a mellow hoppy body.
From tap. Bright clear yellow with a foamy white head. Not much going on with the nose but flavors are fresh citrus, grass, malt to round out. Simple, clean and refreshing.

Clear light golden with a thick white foamy top. Lovely bready grainy nose thats lightly floral hoppy with a kiss of honey. Smooth crisp flavor with a smooth honeyed semisweet bready malty tone with a slight citrusy floral hop tone with a clean finish.

Pours piss yellow with an absence of aroma and a smooth, unremarkable flavor. It is a refreshing hot weather beer nothing more, nothing less. Good for cuddling in the corner booth with your cutie butt.
12oz bottle. Pours gold with a medium white head. Aroma is grass. Taste is grass and some grain. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Not really bitter or crisp enough to be a decent kolsch.
12 oz bottle. Gold color with a white head. Aromas of hay, bubble gum, lemon, and a little sweet fruit. Flavors of grass, slightly spicy, sugary malts. Light body, easy drinking.

Cerveza color amarillo claro. Corona de espuma pequeña de baja retención. Aroma a granos y ligeramente a pasto. Al paladar consistencia ligera, muy refrescante, con notas a granos. Muy refrescante cerveza para el calor de verano más no un buen representante de estilo kolsch a mi percepción. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Goldgelb schaum ok, im geruch Getreide leicht citrus, recht frischer Geschmack etwas fruchtig Getreide herb saurer Abgang

Sampled from a bottle. A clear light gold with a good white head. Clean and fresh with a taste of light malts with some grassiness. Dryish finish. A pleasant summer beer, and not a bad attempt at making a Kolsch-style beer.

Kölsch nie jest stylem, który znam zbyt dobrze... Każda okazja, żeby go spróbować, jest więc dobra! Kolor złoty, piwo klarowne. Piana biała, ale niezbyt obfita. Aromat chlebowy, trochę trawiasty, owocowy. W smaku słodowe, lekko cytrusowe, z wytrawnym finiszem. Wysycenie średnie, w kierunku wysokiego. Całkiem przyjemne, pijalne!

Bottle. Pours a light yellow color. Easy drinking smooth easy session beer. I'd have this at a BBQ or a summer game

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Total Wine.



Light gold pour. Slightly floral aroma, bit of grass. Sweet grains, a little bit fruit, but not really a full on kolsch vibe here. Drinkable enough light summer beer.
Sour scents of grass and potatoes. Pours a pale gold. White quick dissipating head. Tastes distinctly crisp and light. Low carbonation. Good kölsch.

Average at best. Really bland flat backend taste. Wish it had a bit more fruit like light aftertaste. This is just a classier Miller lite

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice yeast nose with malty opening flavor. A fairly standard kölsch, glad to see this variety becoming popular.
Bottle - Pours pale golden, white head. Lemon, melon, grass, floral, and some other fruits in the nose. A bit of biscuit, light citrus, and a mild hops bitter finish.
Drank from a pint glass, poured from a twelve ounce bottle. Awesome, well done summer brew!
Pale yellow appearance. Golden Amber malt body with a bit of floral hops and a bubbly finish.

Pours a light golden color. Very clear. Pretty well carbonated. About half finger white head. Quickly dissipates. No retention, light lacing.

Aroma is banana bread. Malty, yeasty, banana bread.

Taste is light lemon, still tasting banana bread. There’s some earthy hops in there.

Mouthfeel is light and watery. A little too watery. Very light, very refreshing. Very mild, barely bitter.

Overall, this isn’t that great. I’ve got this in my glass, and I’m in no hurry to drink it. As it warms it gets a little better. Yeah, I guess it’s good for summertime. But I’m not going to stock my fridge with it. I think I’d take Bud Light over this, any day.

12 oz bottle from a mixed 12pk. Clear, pale golden, fizzy short lived head, but good lacing.
 Crisp and clean mostly, does have some light sweetness, and a touch of grassy hops. Very refreshing on this 118 degree day.

Pours a clear straw golden color with a medium white foamy head. The aroma is quite bready and a farm house aroma. The taste is earthy hops with only a small hop kick. There is a slight amount of citrus and some breadiness. The finish is quite dry and crisp.
Clear gold with a fairly small head. Slight spicy smell, lots of carbonation, resfreshing clean grain taste, slight sweetness, slightly watery, decent.

8 week old bottle into a pilsner.
A: Clear bright gold with big bubbles feeding a small white head that fades fast.
S: Sort of apple wine scent.Very light.
T: Dry grainy and winey. Not so much apple as white grape. 
M: Crisp and dry with fairly high carbonation. Very clean and refreshing.
O: Not much smell, not much taste, but looks nice and feels good going down. Not bad but a bit below average.
Clean , golden color . Medium-sized , white head . Aroma of fruits , grain and hint of grass. Malty beginning with mild , hoppy bitterness at the end. Good, refreshing beer.

Bottle. Pours a clear straw color with a fluffy white head. Mildly carbonated. Aromas of citrus, slight skunkiness and bready notes. Flavors are fruity with lemon, sweet corn, grass, and bready tones. Peppery finish. As the beer warms, the fruity flavors really blossom. Clean mouthfeel. A very nice kolsch.
B. Pours a clear yellow color with white head. Fruity aroma and crisp finish.
Solid all around beer for an easy drinker. Their Four Star Pils is a better summer sipper though I highly recommend that, especially for the price.
12 oz. bottle. Poured clear golden, foamy white head. Aroma was sweet fruits, grassy. Taste was semi sweet and fruits.

I haven’t had more than about a handful of Kolsch’s, but would say this is about average for the style. Flavor is ok. Balance is ok. This style seems like a less malty version of a pilsner. Has a clear gold appearance with a light white head. It’s ok for summer time, but nothing to write home about.
Bottle. Clear yellow and small white heading. Fresh aroma of malt, grass, cereal and lemon rind. Flavor is on par. Light body with some bitterness. Reminds me of the Caribbean. Boo yah.

Bottle from beer rep...poured from bottle...clear yellow pour with fairly thick head...nose is minimal with light hops malt some grain and grass...mouth is basically the same...flavors are light...easy sipper but very average...(#801)

Had this from the bottle. Light nose and color but good hops and malt blend while still light in the mouth. 5.1% alcohol but still seems lighter. IBU of 20 leaves a little bitterness on the finish from the German hops. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color is light gold. Aroma is light with a hint of sour hops. Taste is slightly bitter hops with smooth malt hints. Nice and refreshing. Good for summer. Simple. Mouth feel is nice. Could smash many of these on a hot day. 

*12 oz bottle

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
agree w porkchop, seems like a touch of rye in here, or spicy hops that mimic rye qualities. Decent kolsch but definitely Americanized. Crisp and clean.
Pour is clear and golden. 1/2" frothy head. Taste is dry a crisp. Rye? Good, not great. Not what i expected for a "summer beer". Kolsch style but with a mild ipa feel to it.

Old rating. Bottle from Old Town. Slight fruit aroma with light grains on the nose. Taste is fairly watery and thin-bodied. Fairly balanced but not much going on. Taste is more of the same. Nothing special.
Clean ipa with a good balance of rye and hops. Pours a ruby red and has a earthy aroma.
Clean and refreshing summer beer but the almost complete lack of flavor is disappointing. Smooth with some light astringency
Pours a goldne yellow from a 12oz bottle with a thin white head. Aroma is malty yeast, citrus and grass. Taste lemony, yeasty, and herbal hops. Crisp long and semi-dry finish.
Bottle from The Beer Cellar January 2014. Pleasant enough without being off the chart. Pale and thin to look at but not as thin in the mouth as expected.

Its body has a light yellow gold color with great clarity. On top of the body is a small white creamy head. The head fades fast and makes only a very little slick lacing. The aroma has nice sweet bready notes with delicate fruity esters. I get notes of peach, banana and white grape. I get all the same delicate fruitiness and mellow bready sweetness in the flavor as I did in the aroma. This light bodied beer has mild carbonation and a smooth light texture which is quite quaffable.
Drought. Golden yellow with foamy off-white head that dissipates quickly, slight floral aroma, low carbonation, thin body, medium finish. Quite easy to drink, a real summertime beer.
Pours a clear golden color with white head. Cereal grain mostly on the nose, not much else; follows onto the palate. Light and crisp, but not a ton of flavor.
Very generic summer ale. Not much flavor going on here. How funky is your chicken how loose is your goose? This goose is not totally loose.
Taste similar to Miller light very disappointed for price. There is a goose loose in goose island and it taste like crap

12oz bottle 6/03 (Old Notes)-Pours golden with a nice size white head. Aroma of malt, citrus, and hops. Taste of the same with a bit more hops. This light bodied brew is not bad but not my favorite style.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a hazy yet somewhat clear golden body that yields a small white one finger head that dies within a minute. No lacing is seen and carbonation sporadicly rises.
The smell had some malts and hops balanced very well. Some lemon and grassy notes stay in the background.
The taste centered around the malts with the hops moving to the background. The lemon comes out a bit stronger than it did in the smell. The taste gets sweeter as the beer warms.
On the palate, it sat very light that led to a smooth feel in the mouth, the carbonation leaves a mild sting on the tongue. It is a very drinkable beer.
Overall, this is a nice grill side beer that is nice to have in the Summer.
bottle. golden with one finger head. Light bodied summer beer. Crisp, but not much flavor going on. Solid for what it is though.
Cerveza pale ale color ambar oscuro, aroma frutales igual que el sabor, un tanto amarga pero se sustituye por el sabor que deja en el paladar.

Not the best Kolsch you’ll ever have but it’s a great representation of the style. The pleasingly mellow grain taste and the refreshing, light body are every bit as authentic as the mild German hops. Summertime doesn’t reinvent the wheel but is true to the style. As the name suggests, this would be the perfect beer for hot, sunny weather.
It’s like Blue Moon but has a more appropriate amount of sweetness. Too bad summer only lasts three months a year.

This ale pours golden/blonde with a thick white head. It has a strong wheat aroma with a hint of a bitter indeterminate citrus. It has just the right bitter hops notes for me. (Knowing that I like this beer and that it’s IBU is around 20 is really useful when looking for other beers.) It really is the perfect summer brew. It is not too heavy (and not too light) it is well carbonated giving that great fizz on the tongue. Great beer. This is grass cutting beer!

Just awful. It's a poor excuse for even a fake microbrew. Watery an played right down the middle of the hop/malt line. Which is not to say it's well-balanced. No, it's just boring. I will be avoiding this brewery from here on out.

Poured light yellow with small head that disappeared quickly. Aroma was fruity as I opened the bottle, taste is mildly hoppy with a slight bitterness with a light malt flavor. Not bad, but milder than I expected.
Bottle. Smells mild and vague. Pours yellow with a little head. Taste is refreshing, but not very complex. Drinkable, but not very enjoyable.
Bottle. Poured a slightly hazy golden yellow color with a medium sized foamy white head. Aroma is light malts, sweet citrus notes. Flavor is light citrus, some grain. Light, refreshing when it’s hot.

From a bottle dated April 2013. Pours clear pale yellow with small white head. Some light fruit on the nose ... Balanced malt and hop profile a little sweet, very quaffable and refreshing!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow pour with white frothy head. Aroma is paper and a Hinton floral hops. Medium sweet malt nice touch of floral hops. Light medium body with good carbonation. Really clean and refreshing

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste citrusy, crisp. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Decent summer beer, bottle, easy drinking, one of those on your porch beers test it out

light gold color with very minimal head. Smells of sweat biscuit malt, grass, hay, skunkiness... Body is very thin. Some bitterness in the finish. Taste is mostly bready malt and skunk. Overall, not terrible but not very impressed.

12oz bottle. - Pours a hazy, bright yellow color with a one inch thick head that lingers. Smells of lemon citrus, a slight funk, and light spices. Taste is lightly sweet with lemon, pale malts, grains, wheat, and spicy hops. Light bodied with high carbonation.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 4/12/2013. Pours slightly cloudy golden amber color with a 2 finger dense white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, grape, cracker, bread, wheat, floral, grass, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Nice aromas with good balance of malt, hop, and yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, pear, apple, grape, cracker, bread, wheat, floral, grass, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Light earthy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of light fruits, cracker, bread, wheat, floral, grass, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance of hop, malt, and yeast ester flavors; with no cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and crisp mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very good kolsch style. Good balance of flavors, and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

12oz bottle pours with a clear gold body that supports a bright white head. The aroma comes across sweet with malts and then faint floral hops and sweet wort like grainy malts. The taste begins with a mix of sweet cherry fruity esters, floral hops and sweet malts. It gets more and more grainy midway and into the finish which helps cover up the bit of esters I’m getting. Decent but this sways to the sweet side for the style.

12oz Bottle. The pour was a clear pale golden yellow with a large (2-3 finger) white fluffy head that was mostly diminishing, down to a light scattered film and small collar with fair spotty lacing.

The aroma was moderately heavy of a grain malt, a hint of floral and perfume hops and a light moldy yeast with a note of citrus (lemon).

The taste was a light malty sweet with a hint of citrus in the beginning, and then became mildly hoppy with a decent grainy feel and a crisp bitter finish. The flavor lasted a long time following the swallow, with a light grainy bitterness lingering on for just a while longer.

Mouthfeel was light in body with a watery yet mildly dry texture and an almost lively carbonation.

Overall this was a decent representation of this style. It was crisp, clean and slightly hoppy, which made it a very easy and smooth drinking brew... www.facebook.com/KAJIIsBeerReviews

It’s clear, glassy yellow on color, highly carbonated, with a healthy, bright white head. It has a very pleasant, slightly sweet and almost fruity fresh grain aroma with only a hint of lagering. I’m really surprised how much I like it. It’s flavor is clean and just like the aroma, with that same slightly fruity grain character, but with a touch of hay-like hops. It’s pleasing on all accounts, refreshing, slightly dry in the finish, but very clean overall and perfect to beat the heat while still offering a very enjoyable flavor. Good job, Goose Island. You impressed me.
Bottle: Clear gold with a big foamy head that dissipated fast. Smell has a little citrus in it. Light sweetness. Light body. Decent summer beer.

12 oz bottle consumed while mowing. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have pale bready malts, light citrus notes, mild bitterness to the finish. This did fit the bill as a lawnmower beer.

Pours golden yellow with a nice white head. Aroma is bread and yeast and light malt. Tastes crisp and carbonated. More breadiness and a hint of citrus (lemon?) overtones and hops. Fine summer brew; nothing memorable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Pale golden color with minimal white head, softly carbonated. Aroma is slightly fruity. Lightly sweet with a bit of wheat flavor. Light bodied with just a bit of sweetness. Decent for a hot summer day.

27/VII/13 - 12 Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - bottled: II/15/13 (2013-672)Thanks to Yuang for the bottle!


Clear dark yellow beer, fizzy small white irregular head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, bit sugary, honey, fruity notes, grapes. MF: ok carbon, light to medium body. Taste: sweet start, bit sugary, tangerines, bit lemony, slightly bitter hops, some citrus. Aftertaste: little bitter, white grapes, grassy touch, pretty water. Not as bad as I had feared.
It tasted like a run of the mill summer beer. It’s beer and I enjoy beer. Refrigerator.
Pours gold. Really lacks any flavor what so ever. Not a great offering from goose island at all.
12oz bottle. Pours a bright golden yellow color with a thin foamy white head. Aroma of bready malt, lager yeast?, lemon, and fresh grass. Taste of light lemony citrus, grass, and A light breadiness.

12 oz bottle. Pours deep golden with short-lived, foamy, white head. Aroma is of biscuit malt, light Noble hops and hint of lemon. Body is medium and slightly crisp. Herbal hops, biscuit malt and hint of citrus nicely balanced on the palate. Finish is long and semi-dry. Very nice summer brew.

Pours clear golden yellow with a slight white head. Aromas of lemongrass, biscuity malts and floral hops. Crisp light mouth with a nice balance of maly sweetness and bittering hops. Very refreshing. Seems a bit hoppy for a kolsch, but very good regardless.
Bottle. Poured light golden yellow no head. Ok sweet aroma thats nonspecific. Smoothish sweet malty taste.
Got a case of it cheap here nearing the end of summer (still before the 180 days freshness). Very light, with a little hint of citrus and not much else.
Clear pale gold pour with a nice fluffy white head. Sweet grainy aroma with a hint of lemon. Taste is slightly sweet initially then goes into faint citrus rind. Really easy to drink.
Pours a clear golden color from the bottle, with a white head. Some sweetness, light malt, and a bit of fruitiness. Bland and watery, no thanks.

Pours pale golden into the glass, with a medium-size white head that leaves fizzy lacing. The nose is of grain, citrus, and grass. Flavors are light, with grain, sour orange and coriander, with a finish that fades to grassy bitterness. A very light malt base carries the whole enterprise. Light body and lively mouthfeel begs for quaffing quickly. Summertime represents the style well. This beer is for drinking, not for contemplating.

Bottle from Wal-Mart: Poured a light straw blonde with thick frothy head which ended up sticking around like a real quality beer should be. Aroma is mild and has a smell similar to a kolsch style beer with minor trace of grass and wheat. The beer drinks easy and with a soft smooth velvet palate while the liquid has dense weight.
I thought this was a good summer brew. Poured yellow with a white head. Aroma of sweet buttery malt. Like candy but refreshing. Light. Easy drinking.
Pours clear golden color with white head. Grassy and grainy aroma. Flavors of grass and grains with light sweetness. Light to medium body with average carbonation.
A yellow-pale ale with summer notes of citrus and crisp wheat. Its a good summer ale with a medium body.

Bottle pour at Rocket City Brewfest. Pale clear straw-colored with a light lacy head. Fresh, grassy aroma with some spice. Lightly sweet but dry at the same time, light with a crisp taste. Some hops, some grass and a slight spiciness. Crisp, slightly bitter finish. Very nice light, refreshing beer.
Straw colored body with white head. Minimal aroma. Bready flavor. Light body. More pale ale than kolsh imo. Serviceable.
A great simple beer, with no overpowering aftertaste. Good color and easy pour make it settle good in you glass.

Tap - small foamy head, light gold color, balanced mild aroma and flavor, slightly sweet and fruity, not bad but expected a little better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ok for a kolsch summer brew. Just average. Kind of too close to a Michelob summer type brew. Not flavorful to watery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Floral and estery nose. Light golden color. Clear and small foamy white head. Flavors were a mixture of fruity and bitter hops, with a clingy finish in both bitter and wheaty malts. Not too bad.
Poured bright gold with a thin, bubbly head. Faint floral aroma. Pretty lacking in taste, but somewhat refreshing due to the watery body.
Pours a hazy gold with a so-so head. Malt and bread notes. Not a ton of flavor, but not bad, either.
On draft at Meriweather Post Pavilion. Poured hazy gold with virtually no head. Bready, wheaty flavor with a sort of astringent hop finish. Meh.

Poured from a bottle, clear and yellow, but didn't really produce an aroma. Maybe some wheat? Taste was more full than I expected from a Kolsch; it had some hops, but not much.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Clear, yellow color. White foam. Aroma of puffed wheat, crisp malts, and floral hops. Crisp flavor, bold hop. Hops flavor tastes like cardboard. An odd finish. It’s good for after mowing the lawn. (3760)
Six-pack from the grocery. Pale yellow pour with head that dissipates quickly. Very minimal aroma, Taste is dough and sweetness (bubblegum?) with a quick finish. Seems okay.
Great for the summer. Nice session beer, low abv and crisp taste makes it easy drinking. It’s what mass produced light beers whish they were

Light Yellow, Huge Foamy Head, Lots of Spotty Lacing. Sweet, light sour, decent bitter finish. Borderline watery, easy to drink. True representation of the Kölsch style. Pretty Good for what it is. The only thing that surprised me... made in NY...
Pours white thick head, nice golden body, nice lacing. Very mild aromas of grain, cereal and some fruits. Taste somewhat sweet and bitter.

Clear yellow brew with little head that died out fast. Very little aroma, didn’t set my expectations for the taste with such wimpy aroma. Taste was better than expected but not by much. Other than having some mild hop flavors it is just another boring lager.

With the bad memory of the cup slowly receding, I begin a new drinking the one Chicago, er, New York, beer readily available here. (Thanks InBev). Light dough aroma, bubblegum floral with powdered sugar. Very sweet rock candy like flavor, a touch of bitter up front. Also crisp at start, quickly flushes out. Ah to long summer days...for drinking.

12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, grass and citrus. Taste is malts, bread and a hint if citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Blue monk. Golden yellow clear pour with a white head that laces down the glass. Nose is bready, a little perfumy. Taste is wheat,bread, flowers, a weird perfumy flavor. Not awful but a little strange.
Pours a light golden with good head and OK lacing. Aroma is a bit corny and grainy, with some honey and yeast in the background. Taste is nicer, with more honey and light citrus, finishing clean.

Poured into a pint glass. Golden straw color with a thin fizzy off white head. Aroma is pretty typical lager. Flavor is light bready malt with some citrus notes. Light bodied and well carbonated. Not a whole lot to it, but pretty decent and quite refreshing.
A good brew for this humid Kentucky weather. Refreshing and crisp. Lacks flavor and taste.

Deep straw color pouring with a one inch head that settles to a 1/8". Aroma of straw, dust and light fruity. Very fruity taste with a fizzy mouthfeel and light refreshing body. A bit to sweet for my liking, esp. for a kolsch style. Should be more bitter.
poured golden with white foamy head. the nose was grassy, sweet, flowery. initial taste was sweet, light, and extremely fizzy. It was a tad bitter at the end. Overall a easily drinkable summer brew.

Draft at Momo's. Clear golden pour with a bubbly white head. Grainy, sweet, honey like, orang aroma with some grassy floral notes. Light crisp pils malt flavor with light grassy bite at the the end. Pretty standard but not terrible.

Summertime pale ale. Light malt flavour slightly citrus. Smells largery. Crisp

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. I only know Goose Island post-AB so I don't know if their main beers were ever good, but this is unimpressive.

Pours clear pale yellow with a medium white head...lively. aroma has notes of lemongrass and straw. Flavor follows suit...definitely some malty sweetness beneath grass/lemongrass. Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is bitter and slightly resinous.
Clear yellow with white head. Aroma is negligible. Taste is malty worh a chalky feel. Not something I will drink again.
Pours yellow color. Aroma is malty and lightly fruity. Nice light taste with a little citrus at the end. Decent beer.

This a ’meh’, not at all what I expected for a ’summertime’ brew. 12oz bottle, A nice clean, clear gold with a thin white head with minimal lacing. Nose is quite malty, almost sour - reminds one of a Bud heavy initially (same on first taste). A slightly sour, malty texture on the tounge with the same finash as, dare I say, a typical adjunct brew you might find in a red-and-white can. Fairly disappointed in this one, was expecting something lighter and less ’heavy’.

Pours a cleat light yellow with a light white head. Aroma of lemon grass and hops. Taste is lightly malted up front with a grassy sour note followed by a mild hop bite



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow beer with a small white head. Grassy, citrus and hoppy aroma. Similar flavour. Refreshing nice beer :-)
Poured clear pale yellow. Crisp light body, slight citrus aroma. Nothing special, drinkable summer beer

Summer sweet aroma. Light pale yellow appearance. Very light citrus lager taste. Crisp and refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear yellow gold with a small white head.  Aroma is earthy, citrus and grain.  Taste is sweet with light bitters.  Light bodied, smooth and refreshing. Solid kolsch.
Crisp, clean a little sweet. Pours a perfect pale yellow. Not much aroma, a little malty. Very easy to drink though.

Pours yellow with a thin white head.  Crisp refreshing beer with a slight citrus finish.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle. Pours clear pale yellow with a frothy white head. No hop character. Easy to drink a lot of it. The aroma is  malty, grain, wheat, fruity, light hops, and lemon. The flavor is slightly Flavor is slightly sweet, slightly acidic, and mildly bitter. Dry finish. Light to medium body and low carbonation.

A decent summer ale.  Little fruity and a little wheaty. Smells fruity as well.  Refreshing summer beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a very clear golden yellow color with a frothy white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is grainy, citrus, grass. Flavor is also very grainy and quite dry. There is a lingering bitterness on the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.  Great looking beer with thick white head.  Full aroma, fruit and fresh hay.  Flavour is something of a disappointment. Rather thin grass.  Something of a pickle juice note in the finish
Bottle. Golden beer with a cream head. Spice and grain aroma. Spice and light citrus flavor. Medium bodied. Spice and light citrus lingers.

Poured from a bottle.  Pale yellow with white head that disappates fairly quickly.  Mostly malt in the flavor, no hop bitterness.  Did pick up some banana flavor common with German beers.  Overall, this wasn’t a very interesting beer for me.

Pale yellow with quickly dissipating white head.  Very drinkable and great for the hot summer days.  Very pleasant mouth feel with absolutely no hop to it.  Would be a beer you could drink a ton.  Best description from FoneFan " Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, wheat, fruity, light hoppy, lemon. Flavor is moderate sweet, light light acidic and light to moderate bitter with a average duration, and a dry finish. Body is light to medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft."

The head is unrobust, the body blond. It smells a bit sweet and fruity. The taste is malty, sweet, and fruity-citrus-orange. The body is light and the fruity taste almost just on the tongue. So in the aftertaste it gets quickly very mild and uninteresting. Medium, for a Kölsch ok. 11/10/10/10/12/10
Bottle from Kroger.  Very light pour with a small white head.  Aroma is light, grainy, and lemon.  Taste is still light and grainy.  Nice, almost citrus, finish.
From bottle. Nice golden color with an inch of white head. Aroma was malty with a little citrus hops. Taste was similar with a more lemon citrus flavor and crisp end. Great hot weather beer.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle.  On the bottom it is stamped: 30120-B1-1112.  The pour is pale yellow to slightly olive oil in color with a quick fizzy white head that dissolves. The aroma is actually rather enticing with its barley grain malts, melonesque fruitiness, and crisp hop.  The body is light to medium.  The taste is upfront grainy and sweet with a slight lingering bitterness at the tail end.  Refreshing for sure.

Bottle from Wegmans.  Pours clear yellow with a medium sized white head with below average retention.  The aroma has pretty standard lager notes with some light corn and grain.  The taste has basically nothing to it.. watery body with a pretty plain light grain flavor.  I love GI but this style is tough for anyone to make interesting.

Pours pale golden into the glass, with a light ring head that leaves fizzy lacing. The nose is of cereal and citrus. Flavors are light, with cereal, lemon, some orange and possible coriander, with a finish that shows grains, citrus peel and zest to balance. The body is light and the mouthfeel is active with carbonation. For the style, it is very well integrated. Just a touch on the light side, it will indeed be a great beer in hot weather, but it also has enough substance so as not to be seltzery. Very style appropriate.
I don’t know.  Not a very good combination of light body and adjunct sweetness.  Kind of cloying.  I prefer my summer beers to be light and bitter.
Pours clear golden color with big white head.  Fruity citrus aroma.  Very crisp fruity flavor. Decent summer brew.
Color: light brown and clear, thin; Nose: almond, clean flavor; Taste: almonds, honey; Mouthfeel: very smooth and light; Comments: simple but well made and nicely integrated, highly recommend
12 ounce bottle poured a golden color with aromas of grass, light citrus, and some grain.  Flavors follow suit, meh summer beer.

Light yellow orange in color... Flavor is crisp and light, with minimal hop notes but fruity and citrusy character... Decent

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at McDougal Ale House, NYC, pours a clear yellow gold color. Nose is flat. Taste is grainy without much flavor. Finish is boringly horrible. Quaff Score 5 / 10

Appearance- Crystal clear golden color with a thick fluffy white head.
Aroma-  Malt with some grass and hay, some citrus, little floural scents.
Flavor- Lightly malted, lightly hopped. Grassy with some lemony aftertones. Alittle tart and acidic finish. Would be a great ice cold refreshment after cutting the grass in the middle of summer.

Bottle:  Pours bright golden and perfectly translucent.  Huge white head.  Light nose of grass and malts is sweet, but not overly malty like some of the light session beers.  Flavor is clean, crisp, and typical to style.  Grass, grain, and malty sweet.  Good balance.  Refreshing.

Appearance  light hazy yellow with
A slight head. Aroma fruity overtones taste slight bitter taste resonates on the palate
As a thirst-quencher it’s not the worst thing available. As a kölsch, it’s fairly tasteless and not worth the effort of seeking out.

Bottle pours clear light gold in color. Nice tight head that fades quickly with a little lacing. Faint ftuity smell. Clean and smooth with some tingling on the tongue. Mellow hoppiness. Easy drinking refreshing.  Good summertime brew.

You know its bad when you feel like a regular at some jerked off hotel bar... Never the less, the $3 happy hour pour takes the sting of that reality off. Clear gold hue with a minimal head. Nose is clean with mild malt. Taste continues with clean malt, moderate bitterness. Finish is crisp.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a yellow color with a medium sized foamy-soapy white head that faded quickly and left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sweetish artificial grape and a bit of vegetal malts. The flavor was tangy and a bit tart with a bit of vegetal malts and faint citrus and grape. Short finish that turns a bit dry. Light body. Not good.

Definitely smells like a Kolsch with clean, crisp biscuit malt and a bit of minerality.  White soapy head and crystal clear pale yellow.  There’s really not much going on here with the taste, it’s very, very light toasted malt and hay with some good balancing earthy, almost mushroomy, bitterness.  Slides right by and finishes clean with a little residual vegetal aftertaste.  Clean, refreshing and bright like summer.

This poured a darker yellow color with a white head.  Aroma was of light earthy and grassy hops, some hay and grain in there.  Flavor was slightly more hoppy pale lager, with a refreshing palate finish.
Summertime and the living is easy. Clear gold. Whiffs of grain and lemon peel. Lightly sweet and sour. Refreshing

Keg pour during Annapolis 5K beer run. Pours pale yellow/gold with thin, fizzy white head.  Faint aroma with notes of cereal and biscuit malts, grassy hops, wheat, and light fruit.  Flavor is refreshing with predominately cracker and biscuit malts and faint supporting hops and light fruit esters; dry finish.  Light body and medium carbonation.

pours a clear straw with a small white head, an good lacing.

smell is of grain, a little skunk, and a touch of citrus.

taste is somewhat watery, grain, caramel, some citrus, and a little spice.
This is a passable true Kolsch clone, straw hued with a fresh, yeasty body. A fine everyday beer.

Very pale straw golden color with minimal head. Aromas of sweet malt, wheat, bit of hops. Taste is some wheat, grain, rather plain.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a pale yellow with white head. Has a pilsner aroma. A pilsner taste with very little hops/bitterness. Refreshing.

Nothing summer about this beer... A little watered down, good color and flavor, but a watered down lawnmower beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light, malty, smooth. Hints of citrus zest, caramel, spice. Long finish, not much hops or crispness, but refreshing.

Tap @ Mayor of Old Town Fort Collins. Pours a clear yellow appearance wit a white head. Somewhat floral, grainy, cracker aroma. Slight lemon, a bit toasty malty, cracker flavor that is quite smooth but not all that exciting.
Bottle pours light golden color with a thin white head.  Nothing but pale grains and crackers.  Did not enjoy this one very much.  Eh.

12oz bottle. Clear golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma of light malt, honey, lemon and some noble hops. Flavor is light all around, some malt and a clean bitterness, yeast flavors are minimal. Light body with a refreshing finish. Good summer session beer, but I’ve had better Kolsch.
Draft at Moriartys. Clear straw gold pour with a fizzy bright white marshmallow head. Bright mild flavors. Biscuits. Marmalade. Some plastic notes. Decent Kolsch but feels too manufactured.
Bottle from Total Wine, Sacramento. Pours golden with a nice off-white head and a light fruity aroma. There is a crisp pale malt flavor with a dry finish. Not much taste.
Nice to drink, very refreshing and not so bitter. Fine features and nice aroma too in there.

Mug at Tribeca Tavern. Ok aroma, sweet, grassy. Little doughy yeastiness. Clean yellow golden color, good initial head, faded quick. Medium body, creamy, yet smooth mouthfeel. Bitter finish. It’s fine, nothing offensive, nothing special.

Straw coloured, frothy white head which dissapates. Slightly cloudy in the glass. Fresh hay/straw nose, a little banana and faint clove spice. Sweet and rounded in the flavour, more banana and a touch of yeasty dough. Light bodied and soft, tight carbonation lends to a soft mouthfeel. Short finish with more hay and soft fruit. A nice Kolsch.
Yellow, white head. Smells grainy, with a bit of corn. Taste is also grainy and corny, maybe a touch of sweet. A bit of a grassy hop bite at the finish.
missing the bright grainy snap of most kolsches, its not bad in the end. its just more a regular blond/golden ale than anything else.

Bottle as shown. Pours a pale yellow gold with large frothy white head that lasts awhile leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is citrus and pine. Thin mouthfeel with sweet malt and honey flavor. A decent kolsch.
Below Average beer...nothing special of note...watery with very little taste...blah...technically had 2 months out date
Bottle from Sam’s Quik Shop. Pours a light clear gold. Nose and taste are quite lemony, with notes of roasted grain and corn. Light and refreshing. A bit simple.

Strong artificial lemon taste recreating without the sweetness or the sour notes, just kind of "there", backed by typical light to medium lager malt.  Fair.  I was a little surprised looking back on my tasting notes here from 3 years ago, which gave it a 3.6.  First, I was surprised because I don’t remember having ever had it before.  Second, I was surprised because it was a glowing review that didn’t seem to be about the same beer I drank again yesterday.  I don’t know if my tastes have changed, the beer has changed, or it’s a bad idea for beer companies to put out summer beers in March and for beer drinkers to drink them in March.  Maybe it’s all of those things.  Anyone think the change might have to do with getting bought out by AB-Inbev?  Nothing real great, nothing horrible.  Middle of the pack.  3.6 in 2013, 2.9 in 2016; hopefully it’s not a 2.2 in 2019. ;)

12 oz. Pours clear gold with a lasting creamy-crunchy head. Nose of caramel, spicy grass and a hint of citrus zest. Taste of delicately spiced and toasted grain with a touch of lemon honey, followed by a bitter from a combination of fresh green herb and dried spicy grass. Light body finishes dry and has medium carbonation. A tasty (but slightly thin) example of the style.

Pours clear, bright yellow with a big head of white foam that fell fast and left very impressive lace.  Plenty of effervescing.  Nose is lemon citrus on a mild bread malt base.  Some grass and hay and some surprising yeast funk.  Light grains and a little corn. Body is very thin almost watery. Taste is so light it’s practically not there.  Malt has the promise of grain but it’s weak and it’s also not that sweet so no caramel. It opened up just slightly as it warmed with a sweeter malt nose and palate. Hops fade out to some faint yeast spice character and  it’s weak in every way.  No bite, no bitter, no aftertaste except for a strange malty aftertaste that really does remind one of modeling clay.  Colored water.
On draft at Blue Monkey. Nice hints of floral and fruit. Easy to drink, clean. Nice little brew.

From a 12 fl oz / 355mL bottle into a tasting glass.

Aroma: Lemon and sweet malts.

Appearance: Pale yellow and pretty fizzy.

Taste: Starts out with a zesty lemon. Reminds me a lot of those lemon girl scout cookies! That kind of sweet, lemon creme. Ends with sweet malts.

Palate: Not watery, but pretty light.

Overall: Pretty refreshing, but too sweet for me. The lemon was nice though! Could be good on a hot day outside.

12oz bottle poured into glass. Goose Island lands in FL so naturally I need to try them all. I’ve never gotten much out of kolsch beers (aroma/flavor), or perhaps I’m just not that keen on that flavors I get from them but I enjoy drinking them, which is enough for me.
Bottle from the local ABC. Nose is grassy hay, some bread, lightly yeasty and cracker. Drank pretty well with a golden hue. Medium carbonation. Taste is wheat and hay, some grass, lemon. Not bad.
Not a bad kolch. Nice fresh grassy flavors. Easy to drink but good flavors. Not the best kolch I’ve had but still very enjoyable summer beer.
Pours a clear golden with thick white head and tons of lace. Aroma is lemon, breads. Taste is citrus, bread, dough. thin body dry finish

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with bubbly white head that dissipates quickly to leave a ring of lacy head. Aroma of bready malts, grass, slight floral and citrus notes. Taste follows, nice and bubbly and light on the palate. Better than expected, but still a kolsch.

on Tap @ Nobi in webster .. . medium gold .. . medium foam .. . solid head .. . does taste like summer, hay and brick .. . a refreshing brew 

.. .. for once i was pitching and not belly itching!

Pours clear urine yellow/light clear golden with thin, lightly sticky white head that fades rather quickly.  Carbonation level looks to be on point with a continuous stream of bubbles arising from the bottom of the glass retaining the thin layer of lace that remains.  Nose is grassy, toasty biscuit malts, light floral and citrus character emerge as it warms a bit.  Flavor is lightly grassy, toasted malts, nice balance and fairly clean finish with a light green/vegetal bitterness.  Much Better than expected.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a sharp and clean straw blonde with two fingers of sticky white head. The nose is heavier than I expected,  dextrinous and bready notes with some fruity yeast esters and a touch of citrusy hops.   Fresh cut grass in the flavor and just a tad bit of skunking that shows.  Light medium body and dry with a touch of bitterness.
Bottle. Pours a clear dark golden color with a moderate white head. Nose and taste are just a bit skunky like a lot of cheap lagers. Crisp, but bleh.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Light and sessionable. Not much else going on. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a super light amber golden body with minimal white lacing. Aroma is faint overall - minor hop, grass and citrus notes. Mouthfeel is thin, kind of refreshing - not terrible, but just not too much flavor either.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with a one inch white head that lasts.  Taste is of wheat, malt, grain, citrus and some hops.  Similar clean aroma.  Has a nice, clean and wet body.  Easy to drink and rather enjoyable.  A good summer beer.

[on tap somewhere in Chicago]
Weak base malt aroma with faint citrus hops. Almost clear gold under a dotty white patch and ring. Sweet, almost crisp base malt with fruity accents and detectable hops. Quaffable, if not overly exciting. Weak bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation, refreshing with a clean finish.

Bottle. Poured a straw color. Small head that went away quick. Aroma is small with grass, grains, lemon peel. Light sweetness. Slight sour. Below average carbonation. Kind of refreshing. Not much flavor.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  4.9.2010

Aroma, not of fruit, but of grain. Pours a pale yellow with a mostly diminishing foamy white head and spotty lacing. The taste follows the nose. GRAIN from start to stop. Medium body with moderate carbonatin. (I think i would like it better with a crisper carbonation.) Overall, this was a very one dimensional brew. I’d drink it again but I won’t buy it again.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured a yellow maybe a bit hazy with a white thick head. Aroma of grains and some citrus fruits. Taste is also grainy malts and some citrus fruits balanced with some caramel notes. Refreshing but IMHO a bit to sweet for a Kölsch, never the less a very nice drinkable beer

Pours a clear golden yellow with a thin white head. Nothing but grass and yeast in the nose and the flavor is a bit of the same with some slight fruitiness and malts floating in there. I could drink a ton of these but that doesn’t mean it’s a great beer. It’s a decent session brew but not much else.

bottle, poured bright clear yellow with minimal white head and it didnt last long at all. the aroma is a mild malty wheat sweet. lots of carbonation in this. the flavor is crisp clean light malt mild hop. decent beer.
I’m partial to a nice kolsch in the summertime. This is a drinkable beer but there are way better Kolschs out there.

It takes a lot to make  truly impressive kolsch. Too often, I feel like kolsch style beer tastes more like a pale lager. This beer is a bit that way. It’s not bad but it’s far from interesting. I drink it every now and then in the summer. A decent session beer I can say that much.

33 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 19.06.2010

Aroma has grainy malt, some fruity notes and toffee. Flavour has grainy malt, some caramel, toffee and fruits. Quite fruity and not the Kölsch I’ve used to had.

Dość dobre piwo jak na kolońskie piwo i nawet trochę mętne co jest przy tym gatunku niespotykane. Trafiłem raz na mętnego kolscha, było to Thornbridge i było sporo lepsze. Nie mniej fajnie się degustowało i spora piana była
Uhhh lemon? very light cracker and slight noble hops.  Lightly sweet and lightly tart with little bitterness.  This is bleh.
I’m using thi beer to rate my next beer fairly, I just drank hill farmstead Susan and any ipa after that would suffer in review. Great palate cleanser
Light brown pour.  , licorice, vanilla, toffee.   Pretty smooth beer.   On tap at Martys place, Hamilton. ,NJ.
Bottle into a goblet. Thanks to Dave N. Pour is a haze light good with a fine head. Aroma is of lemon malt. Taste is crisp light lemon malt bitter. Finish is clean.

From a bottle served at home. 
Pours a hazy pale gold with a thin white head. Slightly fruity nose. More carbonation in the mouth than expected given the thin head. Some lemon zest in the mild, balanced flavor. Good refreshing beer for a summer day.

I got a 6pk of this from Woodman’s in Janesville as an end of the season closeout in October 2012.

Pours a clear, pale yellow color with only a slight head. The scent has a grassy grain scent that is fairly weak. The texture is smooth and inviting which make for a very fast drink. A rather simple brew as far as Goose Island goes. There is the initial sweet citrus hints that turn into a chalky after taste. Drinks decent but rather average in the realm of craft summer beers.

Surprized I never had dis.  Bottle is more than a year old? 7/6/11? From a bottle pours like a hefe w/o head. Nice clean aroma. Does not really have an old beer attitude. Nice co2 on the palate. Goes down rather easy. Some medicine in the background but otherwise hides its alky well. refreshing at times. Better than expected. Not quite as good as roy pitz, gaffell and mission kolsch.

Bottle. Pours hazy pale gold with a soapy white head that leaves a spotty film and some lacing. Aroma is a mix of malt and yeast with some lemon grass and slightly musty. Taste is all the above with the lemon and yeast being more dominant. Palate is thin and chalky/dry.

20oz on tap.  If it’s a Kolsch, why don’t they call it one?  I haven’t had one yet I really like, this is no exception.  It’s clear and uninteresting, both in appearance and aroma.  The taste is fine, but I feel like this is more marketing than anything else.  I probably won’t get it again in any season.
It poured a clear gold color with a white head. The aroma was of fruity citrus and some wheat. The taste was light sweet with fruity citrus and wheat.

[Bottle from Beers of Eurpoe that Jim shared with me - cheers!] Pale gold, moderate white head and fizz.  Lots of lemon, a little biscuit, crisp mouthfeel with a little bitterness in the finish. Unfortunate metallic hints.  OK summer refresher, but unchallenging and forgettable.
Refreshing summer ale - citrus and yeast.  Pale gold with a thin head, flat nose but has a good body for a summer beer

Featuring somewhere between a refreshing German lager and a hoppy American ipa this both pleases and disappoints in equal measure. Not bad. But not great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 fl oz bottle from Kihoskh, enjoyed at Besser Rev, Samsø. Pours a pale gold colored body with a milky shade. Snowy white top, quickly shrinking to a layer of bubbles. Crisp pale malts to the nose, along with a whiff of lemon juice and hay. Fresh and dry pale malt flavor. Tones of lemony acidity, and a mild and clean bitterness. LIght in body. Lively mouthfeel, bordering on fizzy. Dry. light sourish-fruity endnotes. Quite thin, but certainly a refreshing one.
Goose Island is a heck of a brewery but they come up short with this summer seasonal beer. Weak flavor and not much taste. Pass on this brew.
12oz bottle. Very clear pale yellow with an off white head. Grain, sweet, caramel, some malt, fresh. Mild body and moderate carbonation, bit adjuncty little bit of lemon rind on the finish.
Standard. Strong carbonation, thin-medium body. Some true hefeweizen notes, but mostly an unoffensive, clean drinking beer. Drinks fast, meets its stated expectations. In a word: adequate.
There’s little point to this. It’s not offensive but I’d almost rather it was. Yawn.
355ml bottle. Clear golden colour with small, frothy, white head. Fresh malty aroma with a touch of hay, husk and citrus. Taste is minimally citrussy with a soapy touch, grainy undertone.
Light orange. Minimal white head. Fades fast. No scent. Honey and oranges. Some spices. Bitterness at the finish. Pretty weak. Standard light summer beer.
This beer seems confused.  Doesn’t taste much like a Kolsch, seems more like a blonde ale with too much summery spicing.  It was ok, but not that good.
Light in aroma, palate, appearance. Malty with some citrus. No bitterness at all. A good summer beer for non-hopheads.

Bottle. Pale gold with lots of bubbles and a thin, low head. Clean, malty nose with a bit of grass hops.Light, crisp malt flavor, bread, crackers, some fruit--a bit of lemon or orange. Light, crisp body with a decent bitterness at the finish. A decently made Kolsch, and refreshing for summer.
From old backlog. Clear pale yellow colour with tiny head. Aroma is malt. Flavour is malt, some citrus.

Draft at Keg N Kitchen in Westmont, NJ. 

Pours a slightly hazy golden straw color with a 2.5 finger frothy white head that slowly settles into lasting cap/ring.  Chunks of soapy lace left behind.

Slightly earthy aroma with bready yeast, subtle funk, grass, hay, straw, light fruit and pale malt.  Slightly peppery with earthy notes followed by apple, pear and bready pilsner malts. 

Light end of medium bodied with sharp carbonation up front.  Light and easy to drink with subtle earthy hops followed by a musty grass/hay character.  Faint peppery spice and funky bready yeast followed by apple, pear and pilsner malt.  More complex than expected but nothing spectacular.  Sessionable on a hot day.
Dry, mild bitterness with a astringent fruity quality. High carbonation which, while refreshing, is a little to close to a fizzy lager. Perhaps I drank this at the wrong time of day!

Nice light aroma is crisp hoppy with slight sweet malt in background. Bit cloudy honey yellow. Short white head, bit lacing. Taste has citrus and other fruits. Quite mild taste. Medium to light bodied, standard carbonation, soft texture. Not too sweet. Ok summerbeer. Should have drank this cooler though.

355ml bottle. Aroma - citrus malt. Appearance is pale yellow, slightly cloudy with minimal head. Slightly bitter taste; light, dry body, average carbonation. 

Refreshing if somewhat unremarkable. It does what it’s supposed to do - light refreshment on a hot day. All I need is for the rain to stop and the sun to appear.

A: Clear yellow hue with a big white head that fades quickly, leaving little lacing.

S: Like a typical summer ale, with a subtle fruitiness and a slightly sweet malt & hop balance.

T: Easy to drink. Slightly sweet, with a note of honey. Some spices are coming through more as the beer warms a bit. Pretty decent hop flavors in there too.

M: Smooth, non-challenging.

D: Easy to throw back. A decent beer.
Bottle. Light golden colour with a large fluffy head. Aroma of grain and bread. Bread and citrus flavour. Metallic finish
Tastes like most summer beers out there. The color is a murky gold with a lemony/ wheat/ hoppy aroma. Goes down smooth with a crisp finish. A good beer but just not remarkable in any way.
Good clean, crisp summer brew.  Good style, good CO2 mix, nothing great, but a good tasting brew.
From bottle at the island bar Birmingham. Clean, refreshing, some citrus fruits, mainly Orange.
Nice summer beer... Very crisp! Pale yellow pour with little head, and tastes of wheat with light hopping
Bottle. Lemon and a dusty malt aroma.  Hazy yellow with a small white head.  Grainy malt, lemon, and a light bitter flavor. Light body, moderate carbonation, dry finish.  Rather unremarkable.
For a summer beer, I must say it was just like every other one I’ve had. Notes of lemon, and the usual pale yellow color. Not that it’s a bad beer, just nothing new or special.

What’s not to like if you are truely looking for a very tasty and easy to drink summer beer that does not resemble the mass produced dredge.  Taste is alittle lemony and citrusy with a clean crisp taste and smooth non nonsense palate.  Will buy this multiple times to drink on the beach in Sea Isle and Avalon, NJ!

Pours a bright yellow with a full white head.  Aroma is mostly bready with a little bit of banana.  Banana comes through much more in the taste.  Lemon is present as well with bready undertones.  Crisp and quite refreshing, very light in body.  Your classic summer ale.

On tap at the Water Street Tavern.  Pours a straw color with a thick white head.  Aroma is a bit citrusy.  This is a very light beer with hints of citrus and a bit of a hop kick at the end finishing dry.  Very refreshing.

Golden with foamy white head with a steady stream of bubbles coming up from the bottom; aroma is semi sweet and grainy; Flava is light dry grain some sweet notes; feels light crisp but not watery; finishes dryish clean nice

Pours a pale gold with a thin head. Aroma of biscuit, mild hops and citrus. Taste follows. Light and refreshing. Not a bad summer beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355mL. Pours a low haze golden with suddy white foam. Nose is lemon peel, hay, grain. Taste has some decent bitterness, lemon peel, heavy bread and dough. Fairly yeast driven. Easy to drink, nothing offensive.

Bright yellow in color, little to no aroma.  Light body...refreshing bold flavor up front with a slightly bitter finish.  Nice alternative to your typical domestic lager for a hot summer day.  Eager to compare with other Kolsch beers.  Solid.

Not bad to look at, a slightly hazy bright yellow color with a decent head and some spotty lacing.

Smell is of light crisp grains and fresh lemons.

Taste is quite a bit like a wheat beer, along with some extra yeastiness, ample grains, a smidge of fruits and a portion of lemon peel.

Feel is quite light, slightly slick, and well carbonated.

Overall it’s a nice summer beer, but I’d prefer it in cans.

Date: July 1, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: AV3 Description: Translucent cloudy yellow with large amount of head and lacing.  Aroma was fruity, malty and faint hops.  Taste was a bit sour, citrus/lemon and a slight bitter finish.  Thin to medium bodied and some carbonation.
355ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Edinburgh (4.7% abv on the bottle label) - clear pale yellow ale, bubbly white head, grassy / resin hop aroma, sour lemon flavour, dry finish
355ml bottle courtesy of mr_h. Pale golden yellow colour, big foamy head. Sour grassy yeasty aroma. Bland flowery grain flavour. Dry aftertaste. A bit insipid. Not my sort of beer.
Bottle pour.  Little, quick fading head. Nice, crisp, clean taste.  Refreshing after working in the yard on a hot day.  A decent beer for colling off after mowing the lawn on a hot day.
Pours a light hazy golden with a nice bubbly white head.  Aroma is of yeast, lemon and citrus.  Nice and refreshing, light flavor, lemon, citrus, lager yeast.

Light malt aroma with lemon and apricot edge.  Continues into the taste with a distinct apricot end to the flavour.

  An interesting example of the style with a little more flavour than some other examples

Bottle. Pours pale golden medium white head and bubbly. Aroma of hay, citrus. Taste is mild sweet. Light body, thin texture, high carbonation. Easy drinking summer beer for sure, could use a bit more flavor.

Bottle from Wegman’s Cherry Hill. Pours out a clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of wet grass, light fruity notes and some grains. Taste is of nothing much....very watery body, light cereal and some grain, with a touch of fruity yeast notes and maybe a bit of bitterness. Bland and rather boring.

Draft. Super light in color as well as taste. Has some citrus in the flavor, but it is missing something. Nice and light for the summer though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy light gold with a white head. Muted lager aroma. Flavour is lager yeast with a fruity lemon note. Soft carbonation - mouthfeel reminds me oa bit of cask ale. Not exciting but a solid and very drinkable beer.
Refreshing but watery taste, not much to it.  Tasted on tap at Brooklyn Waterfront Beer Festival, 6/16/2012.
Bottle to pint.  Looks like a Kolsch; golden with low carbonation and thin lacing.  Smells like nothing.  Tastes okay; a hint of lemon at the end?  Meh.

Sweet finish.  Almost fruit like, but lighter fruits like peaches, apricots, etc.  Some factory notes and hints of steel & iron.  Clean palate though.  Tons of grain in the taste.  I liked this one quite a bit.  A good specimen in the Kolsch variety.

This a lightweight beer compared to Honkers.  Straw color with nice head formation.  This seasonal was tasted at a friends house in Oak Brook, IL.  There was some grassiness and the texture was thin.  The cabonation was lively.  The head was frothy and white.  Smooth finish with no aftertaste.

Pours light golden with thin bubbly head. Light grassy aroma w floral hints. Very light flavor, crip & clean. Little bit too much carbonation. Overall not a bad kolsch style. Good summertime beer on a hot night.

Had this one on draft in NYC. Nice summer ale. Light, but not tasteless. Also no overly fruity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle pours a clear pale golden color with a very small white head and no lacing.  Not much to smell. Aroma has lemons, orange peel, and lots of grains.  Very lively mothfeel because of the carbonation, although the body is light.  Taste is neither bitter nor sweet, but the finish is soapy and salty.  Easily drinkable and OK for what it is. I bought 12 of these for a Memorial Day backyard party and this one was not too popular with the guys.

Draft in a mug. Pale, straw color with no head. Lemon peel and citrus plus almost a hint of banana. Flavor is very floral and fruit, more of the lemon peel. Very fizzy with a long grain and a little soapy finish. Great for summer drinking.

Golden aroma that screams summer.  Faint aroma of malt/grain, flavor follows the aroma, slighly citrusy and reminiscent of wine grape skins (odd reference, I know).  very refreshing. goes down easy.  great summer drinker; chick beer.

bottle, poured bright clear yellow with minimal white head and it didnt last long at all. the aroma is a mild malty wheat sweet. lots of carbonation in this. the flavor is crisp clean light malt mild hop. decent beer.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a slightly hazy light yellow with a large white head.  The nose is a little lightstruck with notes of grass and a slight hint of fruitiness.  The flavor is very light with a bit of grain, cracker, just a little grassiness and a very light bitterness on the back end.  Kind of thin on the palate.  It could use a little more flavor.  Light in body with average carbonation and a clean finish.  Lawnmower fare.

Got this on tap at a outdoor event.  Small plastic cup, clear bright golden color with a little white head.  Aroma of grain, bread and a little lemon zest.  Taste was much like the aroma with a little grass also, very crisp and clean finish,  Very much enjoyed on the warm day.
12oz bottle.  Aroma like a pretty standard beer, with pale and light caramel malts plus a little bit of hops.  Flavor the same.  Average texture.  A decent beer.

This is about as average as average gets. Not a strong aroma. Pours a thin gold w/ basicalt no head. Taste is clean & crisp. Nothing really stands out but it’s fairly well balanced.  Kind of refreshing on a warm day & pretty sessionable.

Poured into a shaker glass from a 12 ounce bottle bottled on 4-25-2012.



A: Crystal clear pale golden body with a steady stream of fast moving carbonation to a decent sized rocky creamy white head. This is a great looking beer.



S: Lightly fruity aroma with a mild floral aroma. This smells decent, a bit bright.



T: Oh I am not a fan of this. Lots of floral notes with mild fruits with what tastes like mild toasted malts. Semi-dry finish.



M: Light body with crisp carbonation.



O: Light easy drinking beer, I’m not a fan though, there’s something off-putting about this.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear gold with about a finger of white head. Aroma of fruity citrus and wheat. Taste is light sweet. Fruity citrus and wheat. Light bodied with a thin texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. Would make a great lawnmower beer.
Draft. Hazy golden pour with white head. Very light aroma and flavor, has a macro like aroma but doesn’t take away from the flavor.

Light, hazy lemon gold, puffy white head wiyh good striped lace.
Scent is slightly lemony, grainy...fresh.
Flavour is soft and slightly yeasty.
It’s smooth, it’s good.
This is one tasty beer.

Appearance:  Pours a semi-hazy yellow gold with a thick foamy white head that subsides to a thin cap of white.



Aroma: Biscuit malt, perfumy yeast, almost Belgian like. A little bit of unbaked pizza dough as well.



Taste: Dry biscuity malt, mild hop spice, finishes with a sour twang. Not in an off flavor way, more like a light lager.



Mouthfeel:  Medium bodied, active carbonation.



Overall:  No better or worse than the other big brand summer beers. Very drinkable. Editors note: Didn’t know it was a kolch, as its a bit light on that kolsch character.
Pours light yellow.. Aroma is lemon zest.. Super easy drinking with nice crisp clean finish... Love it
From old notes. Yellow pour with a nose of lemon and grain. Taste is crisp and smooth with same flavors. Refreshing beer.

355 ml bottle.

Rated on 20110327.

Pours clear golden color with medium head. Aroma of fruits and malts. Flavor of fruits, grass, malts and some yeast.

2424
Pours straw yellow with a white head.  Aroma of lemon, cereal, and hint of caramel.  Smooth body with zesty lemon flavor with hint of grain and caramel.  Very nice kolsch.

From notes.  First reviewed 8/30/2009.  Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a stange.

Just from the appearance I can tell this is a relaxed, easy-going summer brew. The pale, nearly completely transparent yellow color with a small, lackadaisical head sets the tone. Rising carbonation helps to preserve some of the head.

Summertime has a very soft aroma, with pale malt complementing a honey sweetness and light yeast smell.

The beginning of each sip starts out somewhat sweet and fruity, with a little of the honey I noticed in the aroma. Some earthy yeast flavors poke through in the middle, with a light citrus hop flavor showing up at the end. Overall, quite a mild taste.

A very light feel, with slightly below average carbonation. 

This beer was designed to go down easily. Having a few of these on a lazy summer afternoon is the way it is meant to be enjoyed.

Bottle at home.
Light hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma moderate malty (caramel), light hoppy (straw). Flavor medium sweet. Light body.
Perfect for a hot summer day after mowing the lawn or at a BBQ. Color is a neutral yellow and has a well balanced taste with its malts, yeast and hops. My go to beer in summer
This is one of the best Kolsh beer i had. Love the fllavor of it, easy drinkable
Fine Kölsch which is perfect on a summer beer. Poor foam. Good easily drinkable. Price and quality hangs not good together.

Thanks to Pawola22 for sending me this bottle.

The beer pours a very light, slightly hazy yellow color with a white head. Te aroma is full of wheat and grass, with a little bit of green grape mixed in. 

The flavor is very similar to the aroma. I get a lot of wheat notes, which is the dominant flavor. There is also a little bit of grass and some grape notes mixed in, as well as a little bit of pepper. 

Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

I like this - firm and a nice combo of malts and yeast. It’s crisp like a lager but has a bit of oomph to it. Tidy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to dantheman at great grog for hooking me up. Pours pale yellow with thin white head. Nice light hoppy aroma, grassy, bready. Taste is the same with a nice caramel and honey malt character. Refreshing on the palate. Not bad.......for a lager

A: The pour is a slightly hazed golden color with a finger of white head.

S: Smells very strongly of lemon peels.  A bit of banana, straw, and pale malts.  Some bready aromas and a little bit of grass.  Maybe a little bit of honey and spice aromas.

T: Sweet corn flavor with a little bit of malt flavor.  Some lemon and lemon zest.  Some floral hops and a little bit of straw.  A touch of yeast.  A light spiciness.  Very strange.

M: Light in body with medium carbonation.

O: Not a very good kolsch.  Very strange.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into unique Summit glass, which is the closest I have to a Stange. 

Appearance: Mostly clear light gold with slight yeast suspension. Foamy stark white head at first, leaving some bubbly lacing.

Aroma: Dry apple, pear, citrus and bread. Almost tart. Touch of noble hops.

Taste: Very dry malts with apple, lemon, bread and hay. Very peppery finish.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, medium body (fuller and creamier than it looks). Very dry finish.

Overall: Simple but very refreshing Kolsch. Can’t decide if the very peppery finish is an asset or a detriment.

Fine head, lightly cloudy yellow. Not very Kölsch like? light and clean fruity nose. light body with medium length. Taste is fruity and very pleasant. Light german hoppiness. Very easy drunk and delicate.
Bottle. Yellow-gold body, thin white head. Orange peel, lemon, grassy hops. Sweet, peppery taste, with bitter notes. Dry finish. Good.

A clear, apple juice colored beer with a small white head.  The aroma has some citrus, malt, and grassy hops.  The flavor is sweet, hints of honey and citrus, but a little thin.  I guess that’s what makes it an easy drinking summer beer.

On tap at Madison’s - Yellow pour with a thin white head. Weird corn note on the nose. Not the hop presence I was expecting--just a bit of corny malt. Taste is light, with a bit of the same corn and some real faint herbal hops on the finish. Carbonated well, with a thin, watery body. Pass.

I’m a big fan of the Goose Island seasonals, and this is truly a perfect summer beer-- drinkable, refreshing, cheaply purchased in 12-packs. Pours light gold with an unsubstantial head. Smells and tastes very strongly of lemons and sweeter fruits, but well-balanced with spicy hops as well.
Bottle (35 cl) at The White Horse, London. Clear golden, medium white head. Bready and grainy aroma. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

Bottle @ White Horse. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head leaving lace. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, sweet and floral. Flavor is fruity, honey, acidy, malty and bitter. Finishes thin bitter and fruity.
Look and taste of sour lemon and grass.  Taste is consistent throughout.  Bitter carbonation in the finish.
Bottle at The White Horse, London. Golden beer, small head. Grassy aroma, perfume, hay notes. Grassy flavor, citrus, some fruits.

On tap at GI Clybourne. Aroma: Lots of cereal, toast fresh bread and lemon. Appearance: Hazy pale yellow, almost white. Taste: Lemon wheat and fresh bread. Palate: Light and well carbed, fluffy. Overall: Summertime love, awesome kolsch. Exactly how it should be done.
Very light.  Pale yellow gold colt, small white foamy head.  Very clean And crisp.  Clean finish.  Not my favorite style.

Pour form a 12 oz bottle. Gloriously gleaming gold brew with fluffy white head. Aroma of light grains, citrus, a little spice. Taste is light and crisp - light grains with a dry finish. Overtones of citrus and a bit of herbal hops. Nice.

Draught @ Amity Hall, New York, NY

Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and citrus. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

(Bottled) An American take on a style thats hard to do and people like to bicker about on the forums, had me skeptical.  I dunno about authenticty but its got good flaours /  Lemony and dry hops dance around my tounge .

Aroma is lemony hops, grass, floral, and cracker. Flavor is similar to nose, abrupt, crisp finish with a nice dryness. SImple but very refreshing. On par with all the other summer Kolsch’s and Blonde Ales in my fridge right now.

Tap: Clear yellow gold with a white ring head.  Grapey aromas with a little fart mixed in.  Sweet flavors of malts, grains, and green grapes.  Not a fan of this one.  In fact, I couldn’t finish the pint.

Light pale straw color; Light to medium body; Aroma of malt, light floral hops, & some citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, citrus hops, and some grain; Crisp finish; Solid overall - perfect for a hot day.
355ml bottle.  Pours yellow gold with a small head.  Aroma is grass, lemon and coriander.  Taste is light, lemon and grassy.  Crisp mouthfeel.  Good lager.
Pours straw yellow from bottle. A bit of a bread like aroma on the nose. Pours with an inch of foam but leaves very little lacing. Taste is clean and crisp but kind of plain.
Hoppy beer with a hint of citrus in the finish. Not a complex beer, but nicely balanced and very pleasant. Good effort from a good brewery.

On draft. Appearance is a translucent gold with a thin white head. Aroma is somewhat citrusy with a yeasty backbone. Taste is very much the same as aroma. Not a fantastic beer, but definitely not bad.

Wow, I can’t say anything but good things about this beer.  Aroma is dominant orange with lemon, corriander, lime, and slight hops/sweet.  I drank this out of a bottle, but from what I remember when I had it the first time that it was a bright yellow attractive beer with a nice, creamy head.  There was lace around the bottle so I’m sure there was a nice head (will have to re-rate when I can try in a glass).  Palate is not lingering, crisp, but very clean.  Overall, very impressed.  I think i found my house summer beer.  Can’t wait to buy a 12 pack.  I’m glad I tried this one at $2.50 goose island beer night at Langel’s in Highland, IN.
pretty good seasonal from new ab pawn goose island. from bottle, slightly honeyed rounded malts and slightly sweet and bright beer. decent. was left in the fridge, wouldn’t buy it.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a tiny white head. Malt and citrus in the aroma. Malty flavour with notes of citrus. Refreshing light-bodied brew.
12 oz bottle.  Light golden color with small ring of white head. Moderate carbonation. Nose of sweet malt and floral. Taste is the aroma. Very standard Kolsch. Easy to drink.
12 oz bottle.  Light golden color with small ring of white head. Moderate carbonation. Nose of sweet malt and floral. Taste is the aroma. Very standard Kolsch. Easy to drink.

Nothing out of the ordnary here.  The aroma is grass, mats.  The appearance is clear gold, white head.  The flavor is like the aroma: grass, malty, noble hops.  Medium in body.  The finish is noble hop bittering.  Decent for what it is.

12oz bottle. Hazy pale yellow pour. No surprises here. What you get is a refreshing light beer that is perfect for summer. Not very memorable but no bad flavors either, just a light weight, very drinkable brew.

Bottled.
Very Kölsch-like, full of malty flavour, deep fruity taste. Discreetly balanced by the hops, more so than many originals from Cologne.

The summertime has a pale yellow color. Its aroma is a nice balance of yeast and citrus (with some wheat). Upon sipping, I taste even more wheat, and some sourness. The palate isn’t remarkable. Generally, I like this beer, it’s an interesting break from routine.

Pours hazy straw gold with a foamy white head that fades leaving a little foam on top. Aroma of citrus and grain. Taste is nice, fairly bold for the light body, some bitter earthiness on the finish. Pretty damn good.
multiple 12oz pours - Pretty much what I expected.  A no nonsense, refreshing, light summertime ale.  Could drink 20 of these during those perfect summer days.

Sign of the Whale, DC tap ($6): Pours a golden color with a white head. Aroma is of lemony hops, along with a little bit of grass. Taste is pretty straightforward. There are slightly bitter hops accentuated with a little bit of citrus, which I suppose is the American touch. It is plenty easy drinking, but as other people have pointed out, it is nothing really that special. For a summer beer, I’d still prefer a good Dortmunder.
On tap @ Timothy O’Toole’s. Clear bright gold. Pleasant light perfumey floral accents accompany light pale malts.

Bottle.Pours golden with a white head.Aroma is fruity with some grassy and citrus notes.Flavor is sweet and somewhat malty with some fruitiness and grassy notes.Medium to thin body, lively carbonation.Nice easy beer.

20 july 2010, bottle. nose is malty and a little sulphury. tastes sweet, crisp and fizzy. thin body w/ slightly more hop flavour than a lager. malty finish w/ a slight, short bitter twinge. ok for a summer beer.
I enjoyed this beer, althought my fave from them is their Honkers Alr.  This beer is a little heavy for the name summertime, bout overall refreshing
Bottle at O’Hare.  Bright clear yellow, scant white head.  Aroma is subtle, white pepper.  Taste is watery bitterness.
This pours a light golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of hops, some citrus, and malts.  Flavor is pretty much the same.  Leaves an earthy hop finish.  Nothing special.
Part of a variety pack bought for a crowd. Good choice for the BBQ on a hot day, better than getting one of the usual suspects, but not really worth thinking or writing too deeply about.
Pretty basic with light notes of malt with a little hint of spice from the hops.  Poured straw yellow.....feels like i had an old bottle and would like to re-taste.
12oz bottle in Chicago. Bready, beach and warm weather beer. Nice malt backing, toasty amber. Some floral and spice. Refreshing.
Tastes more like what I would think of as a "beach" beer than a summer beer.  Light body, very little aroma and flavor.  Refreshing palate.
chiara,schiuma compatta,leggera e beverina,retrogusto delicatamente amarognolo

Summertime hit the nail on the head with its name.  Easy drinking Kolsch inspired brew where handfuls of these would go down easy in the warm weather.
