Clear straw body with small white head. The aroma is herbal, grassy hops, slightly metallic and just a touch of esters. The flavor is lightly sweet, some honey, slightly floral and a touch of grass. Light body is softly carbonated and a touch watery.
Light yellow color.  Smell of yeast, copper, metal, light hops and flowers.  Taste the same but water down.  Its probably good on a hot day.

On tap at clyborn.  Uff, needed this beer for the MBA card and I’m not sure if I would have done it on any other circumstance.  Yellow golden color with little aroma.   Tastes like an easily drinkable light lager with heavy carbonation.  Gooses beers are normally really solid and they did this one right on, I guess kolschs are just not my cup of tea.

thanks bwp116.  this looks like a yellower miller lite with less carbonation.  smells lagerish and a bit metallic.  a tiny bit hoppy, as a kolsch should be.  taste is pretty poor, but better than BMC and more sessionable.  i like the 5%
Pours a pale yellow color.  Smells of light citrus.  Tastes of a mellow citrus or fruit, finishes with a grainy malty taste.  A very good, easy-drinking, summer beer.
This one was quite refreshing on this very hot day. A nice mix of light citrus, hops, and malts. Poured a light gold with a nice sized head. Went down real smooth.

I havent’ had many Kolsch offerings but I agree it’s very clean and refreshing.  I thought at first I was drinking a wheat beer.  I like the fruity taste but the aroma was a bit skunky.  I dont’ know if that was by design or an accident in shipping and handling.  Its less than pleasent aroma and slight bitterness at the end was all that kept this from being a top rated beer.
Pale yellow color with faint white head.  Watery nose with hints of honey and grainy malt.  Crisp mouth but watery.  Grainy with a hint of sweet citrus hops.

A 12-oz bottle shared wth brewfiend at Cellars Wine & Spirits in St Paul, MN. Pours a light yellowish amber brew with a thin white head that quickly dissolves. Not much of any lacing. Aroma is light citrus, pineapple, some cotton candy, and a touch of honey. Taste has some citrus spice, well carbonated, with a watery malt finish. Another lawn mower beer? Pretty close.

Pour is a hazy yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is slight malts, slight hops and a bit of lemon zest.  Flavor is a bit in the weak dept.  Some lemon again and finishes bitter and watery.  On a bad note this is pretty bland but on a upside you could prob drink a few on these on a warm night and it will deffinatly refresh.

Two words:  Quenching and smooth.  Nice, quaint malty aroma goes into a relatively boring pour, but nothing offensive.  Flavor is very nice...hints of lemon with a nice balance between the malt and hop flavors.  Very smooth on the palate...talk about refreshing...I could go for a 6 pack of this on my front porch on a hot summer night anytime!

This one really hits the spot if you want something smooth and refreshing yet with some complexity to.  Too bad it leaves a harsh feeling of thickness in the throaht.  Other than that this is a fine ale for a hot day, with a slightly floral aroma with almost no carbonation action.  Not bad, but not the best summertime beer.  To me the best smmmertime beer is Franziskaner on tap or a glass of Pilsner Urquell the world’s greatest pils.

Tap in Galena.  Pours clear with almost no head.  Sweet on first contact than fades to a light finish.  Lacks character buts serves it’s purpose as a refreshing summer brew.  Might as well stick with the 312, more character.
Weak taste. Good for quenching thirst but bad for tasting beer. Very watery with minimal hop taste and next to no carbonation. Bland.

Clear golden color out of the bottle. This beer just looks like summer, a very clean crisp look. Nose was a bit dissapointing. Some very light floral, citrus, malt aromas. Nice and smooth on the palate and welll carbonated, this will probably be my go to brew this summer.
Goose island has many fine products.   Unfortunately this is not one of them.

Pours a light golden yellow, clear and well carbonated, with an inch or so of sudsy white foam. The head dies down in short order, but provides solid webby lacing throughout the glass. Slight grain and dried grass in the aroma.

Smooth toasted and caramel malt flavor - light bodied. Not crisp and clean like I would expect from a kolsch, but rather smooth and mellow and more like a golden ale. But I am not reviewing to Style Police standards. Well, not too much, anyway. In any event, it is drinkable and enjoyable. Nice hops for balance and a touch of sweetened lemon in the finish.
Fairly strong floral hop aroma comes from the hazy golden brown body.  Medium palate.  The taste is slightly bitter and thin.

Bottle.   Pours a clear strw color with a medium sized white head.   Aroma is pale malts, lemon, wheat.   Flavor is light citrus, wheat, yeast.   Palate is light bodied, medium carbonation, sweet, thin finish.   Decent summer brew.
Get some slight hops in the aroma.Pours light gold with no head.Some slight malt in the flavor.Mouthfeel was thin with a watery finish.

Bottle:  Dark straw color with good head.  Hops and mild bread sweetness mix with some floral qualities in the aroma.  A little underwhelming though... Spicy hops and esters dominate the flavor at first, and then a nice dry hoppyness finishes it off.  Good flavor throughout.  Weak body.  very drinkable, but not much else to say here.

Thin bright white head of medium sized bubbles.  Great carbonation.  Light malty aroma.  Some light citrus and wheat.  Pleasant aroma.  Slightly cloudy bright gold.   Light malty flavor with a little cereal and a touch of corn.  Unoffensive but pretty boring.  Clean palate with a slight bitterness and zippy aftertaste.  Decent but nothing special.
Smells of citrus and wheat.  This hazy gold pour tastes of wheat and bananas.  It is smooth and refreshing.  It was nice to have after my meal.

Bottle poured a lightly hazy yellow with a small lasting white head. Aromas of straw, malt and a hint of citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread, straw and light lemon witrh a crisp clean finish.

Bottle.  Light tan pour with medium head light malty-kiwi aroma.  Light, crisp taste that lacks in body, but is very sessionable.  Pleasant malty undertones.  Not bad for the style, but not my cup of tea (or lager).
Pours a nice clear golden with a white head.  The aroma is malty.  Flaovr has a slight maltiness with a crisp hop bitterness.

Bottle.  Clear golden pour with a short white head.  Powerful aroma, fruity and malty with just the slightest hint of hops.  Very crips - too crisp.  Firm bitterness initially strikes me as good and organic but settles as something more befitting a BMC.  Medium body.  Fruitiness arrives only after warming.  And not really a Kölsch to my taste.
A pale yellow pour, decent head. Light on hops, well balanced, with a bit of honey. Very refreshing.
Bottle.  Honey malt aroma.  Bright golden yellow color with small head.  Lightly sweet malt flavor with no bitterness.  A very well made Koelsch - one of the best outside of Cologne.
Clear golden, large puffy head, decent lacing. Aroma is grass, bread, a small amount of fruityness. Flavor is the same, very drinkable, excellent mouthfeel. Good for what it is.

(06.15.06) On tap at Goose Island Brewpub, Wrigleyville, IL. Poured hazy golden yellow with small white head. No discernable carbonation. Grassy malt aroma. Light bodied beer that starts with light malt sweetness and corn flavor. Finished with light malt fade. Little to no hop presence. Clean tasting and refreshing, this is a decent drinkable malty beer.

Pours a hazy yellow with a thinnish white head.  Looks kind of somewhere between urine and macro yellow.  The nose is very subdued.  Light light malt with a bit of spicy floral hops.  Nothing exciting or offensive.  The palate is perhaps the best part of this beer.  While the body is thin, the carbonation seems to give this a creamy mouthfilling quality, while still thirst quenching.  The flavors are simple and straightforward.  A lightly fruity sweet malt and a slightly spicy floral hop.  This really does emulate a lager!  Overall, I’d say this reminds me of a fresh <!-- insert Norther European lager in green bottle here -->, though perhaps tasting a bit grainier.  This could be nice on a hot summer day, sure.

Very yellow. Small white head.  Wheat, fruit, some malt in the aroma.  Similar fruity flavor, slightly hoppy, grassy, sweet, light and refreshing sort of taste.  I can see how this might quench summertime thirst.

Golden color with a white head.  Has a light malt and hop aroma.  Real thin clean mouth feel.  Has a clean easy drinking taste with a bitter/spicey hop after taste.  Not a good tasting beer but easy to drink a bunch of them.

(bottle from kramer i think)cloudy yellow body with a typical white head.flavor and aroma is hay,wheat,and any other thing you can say about a summer brew.mouthfeel was on the medium side.easy drinkin’ but still pretty good.

On tap 7/14 @ the Brewpub in Wrigleyville: Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma has mild hints of fruits and citrus. Flavor is sweet with a mild hoppiness and a watery feel. Refreshing on a hot Chicago Day.
Hoppy nose, some malt, opaque amber, pours a small head. Mild malt flavour, slight hop influence. Light bodied, crisp, refreshing. Fair. Not a Kolsch!

Pours a very light and dirty straw color with a white frothy head.  Aromas are of grass and lemon, but a bit of a scuzzy smell that I can’t quite figure out.  Flavor is similar... there’s something that disagrees with me in this one, but it’s hard to pin down.  In spite of all that, it is very crisp and has a light texture that is nice, just the aroma and the finish are not going to make me a fan.

Draught at Old Chicago in Coralville, IA. Hazy golden color with foamy white head that laced the glass. Subdued sprucy hop and light citrusy aroma. Flavor was similar with an overall dearth of hop flavor. Dry, crisp and refreshing. Unfortunately it is better to gulp this one than sip it.

Pours an almost clear yellow with a lasting thick white head. Dusty lemon peel nose. A bit doughy watered down citrus flavor leaves a scum feeling on my tongue. A bit of lingering toast in the finish. This is really not working for me. The flavors taste muted somehow that I find hard to explain.
Ap-3 ar-5 tas-4 pal-2 ov-7

Bottle (12oz).  Hazy yellow with a smallish fizzy white head.  Mild aroma, grain, honey, light yeast, hint of paper, glue and apple.  Taste is pretty nice - light juicy malt, a hint of fruit-sweetness, and nicely balancing mild herbal hops.  Mouthfeel is watery, a little flat, not very carbonated, and the papery character re-emerges as an odd aftertaste - not bad, but a little disappointing ...

Pours a very cloudy (that’s bad!) straw color with a loosely knit head. The aroma is slightly biscuity and way too fruity for the style. The body is med-light with really low CO2. Flavors are grassy and sweet malt. Not nearly attenuated enough. Want to try a great Kolsch in the area? Go over to Piece. That’s an amazing Kolsch.

this might be the first summer beer that ive liked. nice yellow pour with white head. has a bitter start but finishes crisp. delicate and nice tiny hints of both spice and fruit. this style isnt my first choice of beer but i enjoyed it

Bottle. Pours a cloudy gold-yellow with a small white head. The aroma is minerally, bready, and has a slight fruity hop component. The flavour has some minerals and light fruit-loop hops. Brackish mouthfeel and generally mediocre and boring. Sampled at Cole’s in Buffalo on June 24, 2006.
Bottle. Light golden yellow, small white head. Pleasant mild grainy aroma. Flavour is quite light, mild grainy malt. Average palate. Pleasant summer quaff but not very exciting.
Good stuff, had this a while a go, I would definately buy it again. standard goose island stuff.

A typical summer beer: light in both body and aroma, as well as light and refreshing in mouthfeel, and there’s not a whole lot too them.  Very crisph, refreshing.  Ever-so-slightly hoppy, with a handful of lemons/citrus flavors and a decent balanced of hops and malts. Slightly fruity, but not sweet at all.

Bottle: Clear light gold in color, small white head. Aroma was a little lemon, some yeast, and a touch grassy. Flavor, a light fruitiness, some pale malts, and a little floral bitterness on the finish. not bad.

12 oz bottle.  Slightly hazy, very pale golden beer, thin white head and nice carbonation.  Pale malt, bread yeast and a very subtle honey aroma.  Crisp and clean.  A hint of crisp sulphury character through the middle and a minerally flavour toward the finish.  Really subtle, crisp and clean flavour.  Light apple esters as it starts to warm.  Nice refreshing brew.

From a twist cap long neck brown bottle with a best before date on the back label, 06/20/06.

Made a good appearance, poured a slightly hazy pale golden with a nice foamy white head that settled into a thin foamy lacing, fair amount of sticking, good carbonation.

Had a tasty nose of dry cereal and crackers, grassy and herbal with a subtle fruitiness at the edges.

A crisp, dry and smooth light bodied mouth feel, good summer drinkability.

Refreshing tasting, a dry cereal and grainy maltiness, herbal with a light lemon fruitiness in the middle and a dry grainy finish with a nice grassiness lingering in the palate.

Maybe because I worked up a good sweat before I tried this beer from Goose Island, but I thought it quite enjoyable and a good summer brew, especially on a hot summer day.

Clear gold with a good head. Slightly yeasty aroma with a sprinkling of noble hops. The flavor is mostly dry malt. This has a light and lively body. Good lawnmower beer, but not something to go for if you’re looking for flavor.

Maybe im just not familiar with the style, but I thought this was pretty "bland". The aroma is skunky, but not a huge wafing skunk, like Tsing Tao. Flavor is spicey/peppery hops, with carbonation, and a zest finish. I love summer beers for their low alcohol volumes. A good reason to make a session out of them on the boat dock. This one just didnt appeal to me.

Pours golden with good sized white fizzy head.  Aroma is clean malt with spicy hops - it is very soft.  Taste has grainy malt with hints of lemon that is quite gentle.  The finish has tart lemon with spicy hops.  Nice refreshing summer beer.
Nice easy drinking beer. Like its name suggest, it is a good beer to have while hanging around outside in the heat.
On tap.  Pours a light yellow with a foamy white head.  Pretty light, easy drinker all around with some citrus notes and faint hops.  Yard work beer all the way.

I found this to smell a little skunky, like I do many Goose Island brews.  Clear light amber, with a decent fizzy white head.  Very light mouthfeel.  MIld flavor, with some characteristic Goose Island hopping at the end.  Better cold.
Slightly fruity taste. Light, with a pleasant taste. Perfect for a warm evening after a long day at work.
Easy on the palate, very light and refreshing. Pale malts and flowery hops. Hints of citrus fruits. Biscuity flavors. Nothing terribly exciting, but the ladies like it. Good summertime refresher.

I had my doubts about this one.  Even though it was labeled as Kolsch, I did not think it would be of a high quality. Goose Island continues to pour out quality beers of all kinds of styles.  I’m glad I’m able to get some good Kolsch 12 packs now without having to go to Germany.  Highly recommended.
Bottle. Golden hazy color. Thick white head. Flavor of malts. Good summer beer.

Re-Rated.  Confirmed that that bottle was bad.  However, had it on tap at Fat Jacks and it was much better.  Pours goldenrod with fizzy white head that is quick to disappear.  The aroma is all lemon and spice with some weak hop flavor.  A good rep of the kolsch style.  the flavor is lemon and tart with a slightly oily mouthfeel, with some good malt and a nice german feel to it.

My first Kölsch.  12oz bottle, best when consumed by 09/25/06.  Pours a hazy straw with a moderate white head.  Aroma of hay and wheat, some pepper as well.  Lemony up front, biscuity finish.  Don’t really know what to compare this to, but it is a refreshing summer brew for a hot day.

Well-made summer beers are really a hard thing to come by, but this is one of them - nice, crisp fruity presence and enough pleasant malts to keep the tongue interested - finishes clean, but leaves an impression of hops.
A yellow appearance with a moderate white head. Not much going on with this beer. Standard issue stuff with a hint of lemons and hay. Good for hot day of drinking and not thinking sessions.
Very clear with slight white head.  No noticable aroma.  Tastes like lemon flavored water with a dash of beer in it. Fuck this shit. This needs to taste more like beer already.
Light nose, yellow color, fizzy head. Starts soft, light citrus malt, then a big broad hop bitter. Very un-Kölsch-like. Not a Kölsch at all. Far too bitter. But stil a decent brew.

Bottled: Light golden color,small head, little carbonation. Hoppy hay nose. Too bitter for a Kölsch - Light "I’m in Cologne-Kölsch" -taste in the beginning - but than - BAM - Hops a gogo and you are in Chicago!
Pours a golden yellow/amber.  Aromas of lemon, grains, celery.  Flavor is crisp, dry, sweet malt, and a mild hop.
Re-rated-refreshing with a smidge of bitterness. Spalt hop flavor with a little yeast.
My first Kolsch.  Faint fruity aroma.  Nice creamy white head, small.  A spicey, faintly hop flavor.  Nice acidity.  Not much flavor, but very refreshing.  Could drink this like Gatorade.

Had this on tap at Crescent Moon in Omaha.

Pale gold color with almost no head. Smell is mildly citrus and sweetwith just a light hoppiness. Flavor of malt, hop, lemon and spices. Overall taste was very mild. Was very easy to drink, but not something I’ll seek out again.

Mild pear-like fruitiness with some light herbal hops in the nose.  Hazy golden-yellow with decent white head that diminishes to cover.  Very lightly fruity yeast characteristics over the soft malty flavour with some citrus-herbal hops and fair finishing bitterness.  Light body is very dry with crisp carbonation.  Tulip glass, just above fridge temp.  Bottle (trade, Aug-05).  Thanks, npdempse!
First kolsch, impressed with this brew.  second goose island sample, refreshing on this 85 degree early evening.

Sampled from bottle. Pours a cloudy, dark yellow with a thin, white head. Aroma is grassy and earthy. Flavor is well-balanced with spicy hops and subtle, fresh fruits (citrus and apple). Light to medium-bodied, moderately carbonated and very refreshing. Great for Summer, as advertised.

The bottle poured a light gold slightly cloudy beer with a medium fizzy white head that lasted a while but not very long and left little lacing on the glass. The aroma was a delicate combination of sweet fruit, biscuit and subtle hops. The body light with lively carbonation and a slightly dry texture. The flavor begins with a subtle, clean fruitiness. The middle is taken over by the sweet maltiness while the finish is taken over by a mild hop bitterness.

Cloudy pale gold in color. Great nose. Nice accents of citrus and banana. Thin white head. Easy to drink. Slight bitterness and clean taste with a little sweetness.  No aftertaste. Very refreshing beer.

Clear light golden pour with short white head.  Nice lacing as it went down.  Aroma lacked some substance, but what was there was quite pleasant... light fruity hops and some bready malt.  Well-carbonated in the mouthfeel and crisp.  Flavor picked up some bright floral and citrus hop bite as well as a light-medium bready malt backbone.  Quite tasty and refreshing.

Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Quite lovely. Aroma is slightly bready, with citrus, and a hint of metallic. Body is thin and carbonation is perhaps a little too high. Accomplishes it’s purpose though. Crisp and refreshing, with assertive hops.

I guess from now on I make sure there is a wheat reference on the summer brew. Man I can’t stand kolsch. Aroma has some fruit and that’s it. All downhill from there. Slightly skunky, probably good after some hot sauce and your palate is wrecked.
Good, crisp, German style brew.  It’s very light in the fruit and spice department, but that’s what makes it a good summertime brew.  Very refreshing and lightly hopped.
Poured a pale yellow, fizzy white head.  Light on aroma, body . Got some yeast and some clean crisp bittering. This had a strange mettalic taste. Thanks Duane.

How refreshing a summer beer that isn’t some type of wheat beer.  Light gold in color, clear with a huge white head.  Light malt aromas, biscuit and bread, faint floral hops and slight yeast, all very nice but subdued.  The flavor is clean.  Malt, not overly sweet or bitter, somewhat crisp with a lingering yeast flavor.  This is a great summer beer, a brave effort for a micro to undertake.

Faint aroma of citrus. Slight grapefruit taste, a bit sour at first, then a bit bitter at the end. No one flavor overwhelms and overall fairly smooth. Poured cloudy yellow with thin white head that stuck around.

Faint aroma of strawberries, also flowers and dough.  Slight sour notes to start, very light and unobtrusive malt that still manages to be a hint sweet, and a finish of spice and flowers.  Well done and muy drinkable.

Pale yellow gold color.  Medium sized fluffy white head.  Slight grassy hops and grainy malt aromatics.  Slightly malt sweet flavor with muted floral and citrus hop notes.  Finish is crisp and clean.  Mouthfeel is light and refreshing.

Good stuff, this.  Poured from a bottle to an effervescent head that quickly dissipated.  A great session beer; light enough to drink in quantity, complex enough to keep you interested.  Not much maltiness.  An initial sourness that reminded me of a hefe-wiezen.  Slight hoppy finish.

On tap at the Crescent Moon. This was last Tuesday’s pint nite beer. A fairly decent, yet mild kolsch. Yellow with a moderate white head. Lacing hangs in there for most of the drink. Aroma of slight maltiness, slightly grainy. Possibly a little dash of lemon flavor. Lighter in body than many great kolsch, but does not have the nasty harsh cardboard flavor that lesser ones do.
bottle--nice light golden color with a medium head that lasted throughout. Aroma was minimal.  Slight fruit flavor with a light finish.  Tasty on a hot summer day.

Poured from a bottle, lasting head and good lacing.  Appears hazy, golden.  Not much aroma, but what there is on the hoppy side.  Initially sour then slightly bitter, reminds me of grapefruit.  Clean, dry, refreshing finish.  I don’t taste the malt.

Not much to this beer, although I wasnt expecting much either. Works as a thirst quencher. Somewhat cloudy pale yellow, with great head and lots of fizz. No real aromas, maybe some weak malts and citrus. Flavor is weak and somewhat sour with some hops detectable. Get for a session if nothing else is available.

Bottle, best by 9/26/05.  Slightly hazy golden body with an attractive fluffy white head.  Buttery corn flake aroma.  More buttery malt in the flavor but it’s accompanied by dry/crisp sprucy, grassy hops.  Lemony finish.  Light mouthfeel and low carbonation.  No flavor component is really big but they work well together to produce a nice summer beer.

pours a light pale color w/ a decent white head and some light lacing.  Smell is a light citrus hop and a weak malt a bit of rose possibly.  Palate is very middle of the road I can feel it there but it doesn’t impress.  Flavor is a nice mild crisp citrus hop and a light malt back w/ some very light fruits.  Overall a pretty ok beer for drinking in the sun.
bottle.  pale yellow with a huge white head that settles down to an 1/8th inch coating on the top of the beer.  mild citrus flavors and hop aroma.  a nice thirst quenching summertime brew.

Bottle...Poured a hazy golden yellow with a fluffy sustaining white head. Notable lacing left. Aromas were mild, consisting of citrus, subtle melon, and hops. Flavor again was very mild, again consisting of citrus and hops with a slightly bitter finish. Overall I was not terribly impressed.

12 oz. Bottle:  Pours a light golden, mostly transparent, with a white head fully diminishing head.  Aromas are light and fruity (citrus), some slight hops (pine, bitterish).  Flavor was watered down, overly so ruining most of the flavor, still making their way through were the sweet citrus flavors.
courtesy of Viggo. Good hop aroma. Pours a fluffed up retaining head, with lace remaining in glass.. Smooth easy creamy drink, creamy and well-malted, well-carbonated. Good citrus fruity zesty sweet.

Bottle.  Light smell of malt with a bit of lemon aroma.  Pours a hazy yellow color with quick diminishing head.  Nice lacing.  Taste of a small amount of malt, light fruit, yeast, and a delicate hop kick that finishes a bit bitter.  As good as it gets for a easy drinking summer beer.

Hazy golden with soft effervescence and a fast, white head that retained only as a thin layer. Citrus aroma with clove, grasses and light yeast. Carbonation enhances a spicy hop bite, contributes to a dry finish and causes a slightly gaseous aftermath. Citrus flavor lingers. Picked this up on the way to a barbecue and it was a fine choice.


Foremost Liquors, Oak Forest, IL

Thanks to Darkover for the trade. Cloudy light gold color with a dense white head and minimal lacing. Hops and fruit in the nose. Light-bodied with a crisp character. The flavor mirrors the aroma pretty closely. Straightforward with hops, fruit and light malt. The finish is clean and refreshing. A pretty good representation of the style.

Hazy gold with a moderate fluffy head, a little harsh on the palate for a thirst quencher.  The citrus oil notes and forward hop bitterness, while crisp and inviting, adds more weight than I expect from a kolsch.  Not that it’s like an IPA but it doesn’t have the delicate character of a German kolsch.  Nevertheless, on a hot spring afternoon like today this comes across to me as a subtly bracing, Americanized-but-recognizable  version of the style.
Yellow color with a big foamy white head. Slight hop and citrus aroma. Flavor is a little sweet, with some citrus and hop bitterness.

Yellow color with a fizzy fast fading head.  Some slightly sour malt and grassy hops in the nose with a little bit of spice.  Carbonation was a bit fizzy on the palate.  Mild flavors that are a touch grassy and bitter.  No real finish.  Decent for session drinkin’ or party beer for the summer.
(bottle) very pale gold wiht nice white head. Aroma of lemony hops. Nice hops flavor, fairly light as one would expect in a summertime beer. A great beer to have cold on a hot day.
Bottle. Clear amber with an average rocky white head. Average hoppy aroma with citrus tone. Light body with bitter finish.  Good brew.
Straw color with a light frothy head.  Aroma is very hoppy and lemon citrus.  Flavor is citrus and great for a hot summer day.
On tap at Clybourn:  Soft yellow, thin head.  Light, lemony, crisp.  Kind of dry.  Would be very refreshing if served a bit colder.  Thanks to Ma Beth.
Light straw color with a citrus and hop nose.  Just not enough there for  me.  Flavor is not pronounced and had an acrid aftertaste.  I’ll try again when it’s 90 degrees.
Classic Kolsch appearance ... bright golden, nice white head.  Clean citric aroma.  Crisp wheaty, lightly corriander-ed, bready beer.  Definitely authentic to style.  Very well done.
I would not have said "kolsch"...I think this is very drinkable and refreshing but seems too mildly hopped.  I like a little more bite in my summer ales.  But I definitely would have another one.

This beer pours a straw yellow color with a thin soapy head and fairly decent white lacing on the sides of the glass. Fairly evident clear liquid with carbonation tornado down the center of the glass. Aroma is hay, weeds, and grass with hints of bread and citrus. The flavor is light bodied and mildly malty with citrus in mid-sip leading into a cotton mouth dry finish. Not much to this beer as to be expected. Fairly clean finish, a tad sticky, very dry and highly carbonated. Not a bad beer, not a great beer...but somewhere in the middle. Drinkable, but wouldnt go out of my way for it.

On tap at the brewery.  Pale yellow in color with a small white head.  Aroma of apples, pine and yeast.  Flavor confirms yeast presence, along with sour limes and a vinegar-like acidity.  More heavily carbonated than other Goose Island beers.  Hops and malts are balanced, but it’s not making much of a difference with my overall impression.  Body is thin and fizzy.  Pretty unremarkable.
a quick disappearing head, pale yellow color and slight aroma, do not detract form the pale ale flavor of this beer.  i probably underrated this a bit.
Probably one of the Best Kolsch examples available IMO... But Who am I too judge

I think that pale ales and lagers get a tough break around here.  Bottle. Poured a pale gold color with lots of carbonation.  Bubbly head that left fairly soon.  Some lacing.  Slightly fruity, hop aroma.  Champagne-like dryness, with a great thirst quenching taste.  Not overpowering.  There’s a faint tartness, like cherries, and some peachy undertones.  I liked it.
Wonderful, just wonderful, on a hot summer day. Light, slighlty fruity, smooth, easy on the palate. Just a wonderful beer

Bottle.  Pale lager colored.  Thin white head fades quickly, no lacing.  Fruity, light aroma.  Taste is also fairly light.  Overall a pretty delicate beer.  Nothing here overpowering, well balanced light malts and hops.  Pretty nice for the style.

Bottle:  Aroma is a rather weak light malt, apple, and hops.  Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with very small white head.   Kind of a weak flavor.  Light malt.  Light apple.  Finishes like a lot of euro pilsners with a little sourness.  light bitterness.  Second Kolsh I’ve had, and I just don’t think this is my style of beer.  Easy drinking, but not a lot of character.

Color is a perfectly golden hue, with a beautiful, blossoming white head atop. Aroma is lovely, with some citrus and spice. 
Body is light, easy-drinking, with a smooth texture, and never sacrificing anything in the way of taste. Very tingly hops, great balance, with hops only slightly outweighing hops. 
Truly a perfect summer beer. You nearly forget that you are drinking an ale. Extraordinarily smooth, but fully tasty and rewarding in every aspect!

Bright lemon-yellow body with substantial carbonation and a soft sudsy snow white head. Nose of light citrus, lightly buttery malt, honeysuckle, and a touch of Noble hops. Flavor has citrusy white wine qualities plus mild grassy hops. Dry finish with low bitterness. Ultra-crisp, clean and refreshing. A great rendition of a very delicate style. Thanks to TTB for sending this enjoyable beer.
Bright, hazy straw gold.  Nose is lightly fruity and crisp, flavor has a surprisingly hefty malt backbone of sweetness mixed with lemony crispness.  Quite refreshing.
on draft chicago, somewhere: found this to be similiar to their 312 beer.  crisp refreshing lagerish and boreing with slight notes of citrus  and puckering hop malt bitter end.

Not a very exceptional beer.  It pours a pale straw color with steady carbonation and a thin, soapy whit head that lasts the duration.  A light, bitter malt aroma with a hint of the citric.  Tastes like much like a lager with a touch of lemon too it.  The hops come through only lightly in the finish.

12 oz bottle. Served cold. Bright white head of foam on top of yellow beer. Aroma is lemon/grassy, flavor is lightly citrus with very light malt and a crisp feel that finishes with a light hoppy bitterness. I’m not familiar with the Kolsch style, but this one reminds me of a very llight pilsener--not very interesting, but pretty good with a summer meal or for quaffing in the dog days of summer.

What the hell is so great about this??  It looks like Bud and smells only slightly fruitier.  Flavor is slightly citrus and a bit hoppy through the finish.  Feels thin though crisp.  It’s absolutely ridiculous that this gets rated this high just because it says "Goose Island", because I guarantee that if Coors marketed this, it wouldn't break the 2.0 mark.  I mean, yeah, fine, it's refreshing and all, but take a Miller Lite and squeeze in a few drops of lemon juice, and I bet it's close to this.

duvel tulip glass: the aroma isn’t that welcoming. i swear i’ve always had better bottles of this. maybe my tongue’s acquired better taste? anyway, i’ve finally rated this brew and i also haven’t had this brew in quite awhile. moving along... it pours nearly clear, light straw. the head is thick, tight, white, and a bit soapy while the body is a translucent nebulae. the flavor hasn’t much to make up for the aroma. there’s not much here. i think i’ve had a slightly skunked bottle, i’m not sure! it’s pretty much barn and corny. as it warms my palate is cloyed and the flavor becomes more buttery. i would probably confuse it for a highly respected macro lager in a blind taste test. i need to rerate at the brewery when it’s on draft. hmm. i mean, well... it's not THAT bad. it's just mediocre, and not too good. i rate 3 to 3.9 at a range with its median at good and I rate 2 to 2.9 at a range with its median at drinkable and quite lacking. FYI: 1 to 1.9 averages drinkable yet not shit and anything below 1 is just shit.

Draught:  Light yellow.  Cloudy.  Diminishing, average, creamy white head.  Good lacing.  Light hay malt flavors, with slight citrus hop notes and barnyard yeast.  Corn flavor as well.  Light body and thin texture.  Average carbination.  Little taste.  Citrusy.

A pale golden body with a fluffy, white head. Not much lacing.

Nice malt aroma with a little hop coming through.

Crisp, malty flavors dominate. The slightly spicy hop flavor adds a nice balance.

Light and refreshing beer. Smooth and easy to drink.

Thanks to Drnk_McDermott for this one.  Pours light lemon yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma of malt, citrus, hops.  Tastes malty, with citrus and hops at mid-palate, and a dry citrus finish.  Medium to light on the palate.  I noticed very slight candi sugar and fruit qualities at the finish.
Pale yellow, little head.  Ultra faint lemon aroma.  Wheat bread flavor.  Slight bitterness on the finish.  I like a good kolsch, but there just wasn’t much to this.
Golden color, bubbly, has a mild fruity undertone to it (green apple, melon, but mild). Some hops at the finish, quenching.
7/5/01:  Bottle.  Light lemon aroma with a touch of hops.  Clear lemon yellow body with a large head, which quickly dissipates.  Slight lace left.  Small, lemon hop flavor.  Clean, refreshing finish.

A perfect beer for hot humid summers. 

 Pours a nice clear gold, and small to medium head. Aroma is clean and somewhat fruity. Flavor is a little hops, a little fruit, and a little malt. Very crisp clean taste and finish

Again, a member of our 9 samples at the tour. Not my style, as I prefer the bastardized American ales >:-) Anyway, looks like a summertime beer, smells like a lager with some fruity highlights. Nothing too special, though very easy to drink and thirst-quenching.
not my favorite style.  clear gold color light body.  refreshing. taste probably a little obscured by all of the other brews i sampled that day.

Pours a clear golden with a white head. Nice grassy hoppy aroma. Good hop presence along with hints of light lemony/citrus fruity sweetness, grass, grain and malt. Surprisingly dry on the palate for a summer brew. Mouthfeel is a little light and fizzy but the overall taste is full and round. I’m not an expert on this style at all, but it somewhat resembles a pilsner to me.
Light Honey Coloring.  Little head.  Fruit, hops...but very smooth and little flavor...uneventful beer.
Light yellow color with little head.  Very bland aroma and taste.  Maybe some hops, malt, and fruit, but nothing would come right out and say "hey, taste me!"  Too bland.

Bottle into small plastic tasting cup, Humulus Lupus @ Jak’s Tap (Chicago).  I’ve had this bunches, and its a good seasonal beer.  Citrusy, dry, lager-ish, with nice bitter GI hops at the end (I find that many GI beers have this same taste).  Yellow and clear in the cup, not much of an aroma.

12 oz bottle, at my friend Eric’s wedding rehearsal dinner in Chicago.  Fairly dry on the tongue, fruity nose, light sour apples, woody notes towards the end, light caramel maltiness, quite clean and quaffable.

Bottle pours light yellow, translucent, small white milkish like head, beaucoup carbonation, with attractive lacing.   Light malts on the nose, slightly sweet, with minor hints of fruit.   Slightly grassy up front, developing some grain flavors as time goes on.   Finishes light, clean, and without much trace of its initial flavors.   Not bad...   Thanks goes out to TChrome for the trade!
crisp and clean, very light.  could drink a whole case of them.  has kind of an annoying sharp  bitterness that tastes like ear wax.
extremely pale, very large head.  lightly sour aroma of hops, maybe saaz(?) and a little grapey sweetness.  very thin but good mouthfeel and carbonation.  very refreshing, but nothing special.

This beer didn’t stink.  But it wasn’t so good either.  Amber with white foamy head.  Light malty sweetness amd some fruit notes to the nose.  Good mouthfeel but not rich and rewarding.  Clean, smooth, crisp taste.  Good "Lawnmower Beer" and I mean that in a good way.
This beer is pretty good.  It definitely works well as a summer beer and just makes me wonder if this brewery is available in Las Vegas at all...anyone know?
I was disappointed.  This had some head and a bit of color to it, but the flavor was well below what I was hoping for in the Kolsch.

From the Tap.  Wow, this was awful.  I don’t know if the style is supposed to be this bland, but when the bartender handed me the glass and it looked even more watered down than most lite beers, I was wary.  It had a head, that was a good sign.  First drink, incredibly watery, no malt or hops.  I had to hand it to my friend to confirm my suspicions.  Yes, he thought it was bad too.

Looks and smells like a macro.  Poured a decent head of large bubble and quickly disappeared.  Taste is better than looks or smell but I get a definite dirty-copper flavor.  No real finish.  Might be good on a hot summer day after mowing the lawn.

Appearance is, well, rather macro swillish.  Medium pale gold color with a mostly diminishing egg white head.  Aroma is restrained with some light spiciness and a mild suggestion of hops.  Flavor betters the aroma and appearance.  Flavors detected include decent hoppiness a bit of white pepper and the finish is dry and lightly bitter.  This very well named and makes an excellent thirst quencher on hot days.

There was almost no aroma to this out of the tap at Goose Island.  The beer was mild, with little to no complexity in the flavor.  It was smooth and extremely drinkable, par for the course for a summertime beer.  I don't think it is anything special, though.
Light grass in the aroma. The hops is very light and this is obvious for the style. There is nothing exciting happening here. However, it is still very refreshing.
Hazy yellow, white head, and a good deal of lace. Aroma has hints of apple and citrus. Full mouthfeel with low carbonation. Slightly slippery. Sweet and satisfying.

Well autumn is at hand and I’m drinking the summer beer that BigBadBear63 sent Cheers, thanks and me again!

 Pale golden body with a serious mound of cotton for the head, I’m talking 4” or more.   Nice crisp malt aroma and flavor, lemons, fresh rising bread dough, but mostly barley and lemon zest. The finish is smooth as a freshly luffaed butt; this is texture I’m talking about not aroma or flavor! Dry- lemony- mostly hoppy –yeasty finish-   I like it!

A good example of the style. Looked exactly as it should, smelled fresh and hoppy, tasted fresh and hoppy too. If you can find some, definitely give this beer a try.  It’s a great quaffing beer, nothing too complex, just a simple, refreshing and tasty ale to drink ice cold on a hot summer day.

The beer looked wonderful. It was a little couldy but it had a beautiful white head and laced wonderfully.

The smell was ok. It was full of grains and a little malt.

The taste reminded me of what straw would taste like. It tastes like there was a lot of wheat malt used in this. There wasn't much sweetness and it wasn't very refreshing to me. 

Not enjoyable.
Light goldern beer with little head.  Refreshing, crisp and drinkable with a lemony taste.  Little malty present but a nice but light hoppy bight.  Not bad.

Very light golden, little to no head.  Light grass and a touch of citrus sourness.  Dry at the front getting towards lemon, not all that sour though, just reminiscent of lemon.  Spritzy and dry with a somewhat roasty hop presence.  Might not be the freshest sample, but I reckon there should be more flavors noticeable than what were.
Straw colored, hoppy sulphury nose, well carbonated. Refreshing with good malt/hop balance but with soft palate and dry finish.

Fruity, flowery, malty and sweet aroma, with notes of honey, very faintly spicy hop and pineapple(?).  Medium golden yellow color, with a slight but creamy head.  Flavor is initially malty, sweet and honeyish, with a touch of spice soon after and a very lightly bittering finish.  Light bodied, fizzy on the palate and a bit watery.  Refreshing, though.

Pours an amber with some yellow/orange tinges. Little to no head and quite clear. Aroma smells slightly citrusy, slightly crisp and yeasty.
Begins spicy, with some dry citrus fruit tones and moderate acidity.  Only mildly sweet, but in the finish there was a candyish malt that seemed a bit too powerful and unbalanced. It was slightly sour and cloying after I had had 2 or 3 of these beers.  Aftertaste was not good, and had this old, syrupy malt flavor lingering.  Carbonation added too much of a peppery texture.  Medium bodied is a stretch.

This is the first beer I am drinking today...on my birthday.  YEA.  Happy Birthday Me.  I am telling you this because I can't say much good about this beer.  It has alcohol and it taste like beer...that's about it.
Thanks to Jokes for this bottled. I'm not a Kolsch fan bur this one was pretty good. Had a nice malt tatse to it. As the name says. It's a good summertime beer.
ugh! another failure from goose island. First taste i wanted to wash my mouth out with a lemonade chaser.. ;-) for the style, i'd go with another kolsch. any kolsch. pick a kolsch.. really..

Bottle:A medium sized white creamy head that contained fine-small sized bubbles that was mostly lasting.This beer's body was hazy and carbonated.The hue was pale yellow with excellent lacing.The nose was that of some clove, fruity and light malt.The flavor was lightly bitter from start to finish leaving an aftertaste.The mouthfeel was smooth,  light bodied and it was a beer that was easy to drink although I was not that impressed with it.

Thie brew poured a medium head of fine to large sized white mostly diminishing bubbles that left behind a minimal lacing and a slightly hazy yellow orange colored body.  Its aroma is a mixture of fruity floral malt smells and its mouth feel is bubbly and left my mouth feeling slightly tingly.  THe flavor is mild with notes of malt hops and someting a little more spicey.

poured a golden orangish color with a small head.  mildly spicy aroma, taste was a lightly hoppy with hints of floral and citrus with sweet malt, fairly light in body and quite refreshing, nothing overly complex, but an easy drinking summer beer.

Very Nice very smooth very drinkable. Not as Citrusy as Sierra Nevada. More gravity to this one versus SN-Summerfest. Fuller body also. Pretty Much a dead heat too close to call. I give a slight edge to SN because of the Citrus flavor. Either one is a can't miss if you haven't tried it. Again another Excellent Beer.

Light nose, wheaty, slight citrus flavor. Pale yellow with a thin head, carbonation is present throughout the glass. Wheat and slight citrus flavor, very drinkable with a hint of hops but kind of watery.

Aroma is wheaty, like a Belgian white. Excellent, cloudy, banana yellow, somewhat orange body. Thin white, mostly dissipated head. Falls a little flat on flavor. Not as good as Point White. A little watery.

Nothing special here. The aroma, while interesting, was somewhat weak for me. The flavor didn't improve much. It's not repulsive by far, but nothing to write home about. Yet another Goose Island to check off my list...
Clear, with a small head.  Spicy aroma - is medium-bodied, and also medium flavored.  Nothing really stood out here, but overall is a nice refreshing sweet beer.
Clear light yellow, with clear water at edges.  Big sweet aroma, like a German sweet wine (ice-wine), floral and bug repellant.  The flavor is much duller, but smooth.  Heavily carbonated.
nice, hoppy and refreshingly light.  very drinkable brew.  not exactly citrusy, but yet not heavy and malty...very good with pizza.

Dark golden color with white fluffy head. Malt and mild corn aroma. Light malt sweetness with a touch of light fruit. Light spicy finish. I do seem to remember it being slightly better a few years ago when it first came out, but still a nice summer brew.

This beer pours a golden color with a moderate head and minimal lacing.  The aroma is slightly sweet and fruity.  The taste was fairly smooth and sweet and fairly enjoyable.  I was easily able to finish several pints of it without problem.
Light yellow with almost non existant head that barely hung around on the edges. Minimal lacing, minimal flavor. Carbonation was all right, but there just wasn't much there.
Light yellow.   Nose of pine, oak, and medicine.  Mild lemon and floral flavors.  Just light and dry and nothing spectacular.  RE-RATE NEEDED.
Mild aroma of hops.  Appearance is light gold and a little cloudy.  Heavily carbonated.  Taste of a full bodied pilsner.  Light and refreshing.  Good finish of bitter hops.

Golden color with a touch of haze, not much head but what there was stuck around. Spicy apple and orange aroma. Fairly light with orange to grapefruit flavor and just right hoppiness. Tangy bitterness in the end.

A wonderful example of the style. Gentle floral hops and rich wheat texture. Noticed a bit of natural lemon flavor (none added!!) Not as bitter as Schlafly's, if I remember right. Tasty, refreshing and readily available in Kansas.
Light wheaty aroma.  Hazy golden color.  Wheat in the flavor.  Light carbonation.

On tap: Pours a hazy golden color with white foamy head.  Aroma is mellow and lightly hopped.  Body is semi-sweet and smooth with a touch of citrus.  Refreshing, but at the same time bland...A decent Kolsch.

I have never had this type of beer before. I really liked it. Refreshing with a sweet flavor. Almost like a weiss beer but I know its not really. Although to me it is realy a nice variation on weiss beers general feel. The light (not in a bad way) and citrusy taste is good.

Now this is a good sipper in the hot humid midwest summer.  Pours an orange color, cloudy, nice little white head floats on top, sticks to upper lip until licked off. smells like cereal malts, good floral hops, and slight fruit.  Flavor is citrusy with a hint of coriander or something similar, nice creamy body, yet still light enough to enjoy as a quencher.  Very good.

Drank barely chilled: Light golden,decent white head.Good lacing and retention. Aroma mainly malty(german malts,bready),but has noticeable hop(spicy).Mouthfeel is well carbonated and full. Great malt flavors with a spicy(hoppy)finish. Balanced,creamy and smooth.Lingering hop/malt flavors. Excellent!

Nice white head forms but it doesn't last over a light golden body.  Fairly fruity as compared to other kolsch's I've had and also had a fairly strong hop aroma, but they are both very pleasant.  There's also a slight DMS that creeps in, but it's not offensive, it actually adds to a little complexity in aroma.  Grainy malty flavor with some light hop flavor mixed in, very well balanced, and has a light, slightly fruity, but otherwise clean finish.  Lighter body and moderate carbonation, smooth m/f makes this a very enjoyable summertime lawnmower beer.  Great session beer for mass comsumption when light flavor and body are desired for hot summer quaffage.

Beaming clear golden.  Sticky, retentive white lace.  Enticing herbal, Saazy aroma with wafts of mint, peach, lemon, perfume, and straw.  Lightly nutty, estery, sweet, and musty.  Also notably malty for the style.  Round, softly crisp mouthfeel with fittingly moderate carbonation.  Vaguely phenolic flavors, which lend a level of depth.  Earthy, noble hops dance exquisitely with the clean yeast and pilsner malts.  Finishes appropriately fruity and rich with notes of melon, honey, and a sweet, succulent pilsner malt base.  At last, an American brewer combining the understated elements to make a sweet, hoppy, and flavorful Kölsch.

Straight out of the fridge, this started out a bit sharp.  I wisely set it aside for a few minutes while I was scrubbing wallpaper glue off the wall on a 90 degree day...When I sipped it again - yup, here we go - thicker and sweet with some bready malt, a mild hop along the sides and again at the dry finish.  A few of these helped get me thru a very very hot day.

Slightly bright orangey - gold white head. Good lightly does malt. Creamy, clean and fresh. Velvety .Nice mouth feel. Soft hopps and yeast. All is well balanced and well executed. The best and truest Kolsch I had in N.America so far...
A very clean, crisp Kolsch. Good malt flavor is balanced well by the subtle hop tastes. Finishes very clean and dry. A good summer brew.
Pale gold w/ thin white head. Light hop nose. Light body. Clean flavour w/ mild fruitiness & crisp bitterness.

RBSG2003
Clear, straw-colored beer.
The nose is lightly malty, lightly floral and citrusy.
Regarding flavor? Not much there. Well-balanced though. So is seltzer!
Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation.
Short, clean finish!

Color is darkened pale yellow, very close to gold, fairly large airy, big bubbled and thick white head that fizzed away and leaves minimal lacing in spots. Smell is faint of floral hops, grasses, and light sweetness of bread dough in the back. Taste is breadish up front malts, light and crisp, but the crispness is a little weak, pretty mellowing and subdued in character, with a touch of floral and lemony hopness. Feel is light bodied, trying to pick up some thickness but recedes back into an emptyness a bit. Easily drinkable and mellow for a Kolsch.
On Tap at GI: Semi cloudy, thin white head. Aroma of hops and slight fruitiness. Nice lacing. Excellent.
Quite fruity with a slight (and I emphasize that) tart, dry component.  Has a signature taste that I find in many other GI brews.
I've never been wild about this style, although I suppose this is a decent example of it.

Draft, at the brewery. Tried this at the breakroom of Goose's brewing plant, so if they still microbrew it at the brewpub, it may be different. Nice light color and appealing aroma. Sweet malt flavor, hops are noticeable but not in the way, and some yeasty taste, too. Kölsch is not a common style in the midwestern US, and it's nice that the Goose (and other brewers) are using it as their summer beer. Hope it turns on a few new people to the world of beer.

A tasty, refreshing Kolsch from Chicago's "micro" macro, Goose Island!  Lightly hoppy, lemony aroma gives way to a similary accentuated flavor.  Very refreshing, definitely one to bring to the beach or to enjoy at a barbeque.

Light straw color with a moderate head. Subtle malt aroma with a light fruitiness and a touch of hops underneath. Slightly sweet flavor. A touch of bitterness. Dry finish. Wonderfully balanced. This is an excellent Kolsch. Very nice refreshing beer. I could sit down and drink a six pack of this with no problems. Wonderful subtlety.

Summertime never tasted so good as this smooth Kolsch by a burgeoning micro/macro. Slightly cloudy, light hops and citrus undertones. A fine, golden hue of a beverage. True to the style, this baby is like Goose Pilsner (which I thuroughly enjoy) only lighter. I cannot but rave over this brew.  One of the better Kolsch I have tried (not that I have tried many). Notice it rates number 1 in is it's style (yet only 59th percentile). Give me a hot summer day, but give me a Goose Island Kolsch.

I've heard this beer can be inconsistent, so maybe my bottle was one of the bad ones. Light in colour. Looks good in the glass like most Goose Island brews. Refresthing taste though the flavour seems confused. The spices, lemon and hops seem to be disagreeing with one another as they pass over my tongue. I dont like many Summer Ales, so I'll just call this one average.

Bottle - First to note that for some reason, this beer is very inconsistant, some bottles good, others lack the same taste, rare for Goose Island. Nice clean appearance with small head and some lace. Fruity and a little woody on the nose. Spicy and a slight hoppiness on the palate, finished clean. Nice for a hot summertime day. Rerate on tap - my first impressions of this beer are still correct, even on tap it's an okay session beer, quaffable, nothing more.

Light golden color with a rocky white head that left plenty of lace on the glass. The aroma and flavor just didn't do it for me...some fruitiness, some sweetness. I guess it kept reminding me of a cheap macro lager. Maybe I just don't like this style.

Kolsch is a difficult style for me to get a grasp on and I'm sure it is the same way for brewers. Litle to no head on the pour, pleasant light golden appearance. Hard to place aroma - but do detect a trace of hoppiness. Flavor is smooth and consistent - not as buttery and distracting as some other Kolschs I have come across. A lingering taste of spice comes through on this. Overall - a tasty brew - would make a good session ale.

A thouroughly enjoyable summer beer.  Although defining a Kolsch "standard" seems very elusive, I like to think that this is it.  Teh beer is light yet flavorful with a crisp and quenching quality to it.  The aroma and flavor is somewhat floral and herbal. Teh flavors ebocme more pronounced as the beer warms and more malt is noticable.

(Bottled) Nice light toasted malt aroma with sharper hints at citrus and floral herbs (lavender?) A little hazy, but invitingly summer gold. Gotta love the goose. Ding for the twistoff.  I usually don't care much for Kolsch, but this was very good, and really gets the job done as a summer brew. Finishes initially lightly citrus, followed by a lasting, peppery hop  kick. Clings tart, just a tad.
clean light maltiness, hints of hops thoughtout and  finnishes dry and refreshing

Slightly cloudy gold with a medium white head.  Light, crisp, and hoppy at the start but turns dry and bitter about halfway into the glass.  7,3,6,2,14.

Rerate:  The more I try this one the more I come back to it when available.  A great balance, crisp, thirst quenching, with a great finish.  One of my favorite summer beers, it sticks out to me, and I look forward to its release.

Well, maybe it works on a hot day but it was surprisingly uninteresting in Chicago on a cold snowy April afternoon, either by itself or with a great cheese.  Hard to think of much to say about it, either good or bad.  Great golden color with a good white head.  No real nose.  No real taste, malt or bitter hop ... in fact, tasted like drinking slightly off mineral water.  Almost no taste at all, other than a slight floral taste.  Nasty metalic aftertaste and long lingering bitterness, which would have been refreshing after a malty hoppy beer but seemed silly ... why have a bitter finish on mineral water.  Really disappointing.  One is enough.  Save some money and have some Budweiser. // Slightly more interesting at the brew pub, fresher, more intense, better mouth feel.  But I’m going to leave my numbers unchanged, since the bottle reflects the experience most of us will have when drinking this beer.
Hazy golden beer with a small head and a citrusy aroma with some fruit presence from hops.  Nice thin fluid with good texture.  Good on a hot day.
A nice summer offering from Goose Island, though a better option would be the Bells Oberon from Kalamazoo.

Slightly hazy golden color, lemon/citrus aroma with hops, exactly the same in the flavor.  Aftertaste is citrusy with some hop dryness.  Good, but perhaps I should have tried this during the summer, not on a -5 degree (farenheit) day.

color is yellowish golden, no head. aroma is very sweet malty with a little citrus quality. citrus really comes out in the flavor..kind of like a really really sweet lemon flavor. pretty refreshing and tasty!

found this in the discount bin of a 6 pack place. i was pleasently suprised.  It''s light, very lemony with very little aftertaste.  A great palate and an all round good summer beer,  end for mid-dec.

This was a shackingly good drink!  I don''t dislike Goose Island beers, but they really did good with this Summertime.  Nice and clean with a hint of lemon refreshment.  No bitter after taste and really a treat to behold for the price.

Another well done beer what more can be said to bad its not summer would like to pound a few of these on a sweltering day.It had a nice lite flavor a slight hint of lemon or lime in the flavor clean almost dry finish i thoughtwith a slight hop aftertaste

Light color, medium bite, damn I have sampled enough beers from this brewery.Low ABV is against all my standards, what can I say.Ok for a HOT  weather drink, other than that its not feature product here.

Average to above average beer.  Slightly on the bitter side.  Hint of lemon.  I'd drink again......probably on a summer day with a slice of pizza in one hand and a remote in the other watching a ball game.

Light gold color, medium head. A medium bodied Kolsch. Malty and lightly hopped. Some citrus flavor, smooth taste. Lots of flavor. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet. Very nice beer. Light and refreshing, yet lots of flavor.
Crisp clean summer brew.  All the easy drinking and refreshing qualities you would expect from a Kolsch.

Creamy looking head that fades away far too fast. The brew itself is, clear, gold color. It has a bit of sourness in the nose, citrusy, perhaps like a lemon. Fruity, orange flavor up front that fades to a mellon like flavor (cantaloupe or watermellon) on the end. I think this is a sligtly old bottle as there is a small amout of oxidation to its flavor. Otherwise this would be an excellent beer.
Quite an enjoyable beer.  Lower ABV but malty, so it is not thin.  "Velvety" would be the word here.  Sometimes, I want a beer just like this, no more, no less.  They nailed the style if you ask me.
Light to moderate head.  A light gold in color.  There is that first malt hit.  Actually a well matched hops bite.  But, dryer and more acidic than you would like.

Re-Rate 08/20/02: Clear gold in color, the head is white, thin as is the lace. Nose is malt, somewhat sweet, the front is malt, the top light, the finish is or has a "Hop Presence", quite "Alum" dry, acidic, drinkable, but can't say it is as good as it once was, but for that "Fact" neither I'm "Aye"! Ranks a disapointing #823 on my current master beer list, "What happened to the bite?"
Nice light beer,  ok hops,  dry finish,  nothing spectacular but not bad.  Still would prefer an IPA or Weissen for a light summer beer.
Light fresh hop aroma, clear pale yellow color, watery, but nice flavor.....
I didn't think I would like the Kölsch style when it was first explained to me, but now I know that they are especially refreshing and drinkable when it's hot outside.

Watery and thin, but that might be true to the style since I have never before tried kolsch.  Not bad, acutally quite refreshing.  Very pleasent aroma, but that was the only thing about this beer that remotely stood out.

Light fruity sweetness up front, coupled with a soft spicy hop flavor.  A nice match, with good balance.  Refreshing and light without being bland and boring.  Bright yellow-gold color, small head, good lacing.  Expertly made light ale - and not having been to Cologne, its the best Kolsch I've had.
A rather refreshing brew.  Very well balanced between the hops and fruit flavor.  I liked it better than the other summer brews I have had so far.

Had one of these on tap for starters at the Old Bag of Nails Pub.  This brew is a light sparkling golden straw.  The white creamy/frothy head is averaged sized with fair lacing and is mostly lasting.  The mild and fresh nose is light flowers, caramel, and earth.  The well balanced flavor has a sweet wheatish malt taste with hints of citrus and pepper.  The fishish is average and bready.  The refreshing palate is light, creamy, and lively, and finishes very astringent.
Simple and refreshing without a cloying aftertaste.  Enjoyable as a relaxing afternoon beer, but not an everyday brew.
I had this on-tap and I was less than impressed.  Judging by the high marks, I might have a bad batch.  However, I found the taste to be flat and uninspiring.
On tap, it was quite boring!  Nothing really jumps out at me. No real distinguishable nose or exciting hints in the flavor. Refreshing, but nothing to brag about.
Very easy to drink.  Light and no bitterness.  I can see why its nice for the summer.  Nice and easy, but not outstanding.

Very light body with a somewhat crisp, malty flavor with just a touch of bitterness. Probably refreshing on a summer's day, but why not just have a tall glass of water and then a beer with some flavor?

Great beer!!!  I was very suprised that this beer was so good.  the sample says "consume before 10/19/01".  This is very similar to their Blonde in feel, but a little more Pilsner-ish in taste.  Goes great with pizza and I could drink alot of this at one sitting.

Wonderful aroma this beer has!  Spicy says it all.  Although the color reminds me of a urine sample I gave a few days ago, it was still lovely.  Wonderful beer that goes well with grilled chicken breast and grilled bell peppers.

A clear, pale yellow beer w/ a nice soft foamy head. This is the first koelsch I've
had, so I'm not sure how well it represents the style. However, it leaves a nice, slightly fizzy taste on the tongue, w/ 
hints of citrus. This would be a good beer for a hot day.

Pale gold, appealing and refreshing sight, with a nice clarity that’s almost transparent, well carbonated with a soft delicate foam. The aroma is mild and subtle, but I get instant signs of malt, a little biscuity and buttery, with a slight blueberry fruitiness and a very faint hop spice. It’s nice and soft on the palate with a gentle mouthfeel and plenty of spritzy carbonation. It’s somewhere from light verging on medium bodied. The flavors are very clean throughout, offering the briefest hints of berry-like fruitiness, my taste buds are still learning but I would guess something of a cranberry, raspberry and cassis mix, without being particularly assertive. There’s a mild hop bitterness in the finish, which does leave a slight flowery aftertaste, but the sweet maltiness comes though much more pronounced. A thoroughly enjoyable and refreshing summertime ale!
A favorite of the summer beers.  Great, refreshing taste. Becoming more popular, it lasts six months in the stores instead of 3.
Very pale; almost no aroma. Decent representation of the style, although the Tire Biter ale from Colorado is better. Faintly pilsner-like.
Average body and hops.  Doesn't jump out at me like some other Goose products, but a solid pizza and burger beer.
Wow! Talk about refreshing! Perfect combination of Malt and hop balance. Great color and the lemony flavor makes for a very refreshing summertime brew. Good work on this one!
Spicy and delicious, easy to drink.  Sometimes difficult to get outside of Chicago.
A fragile, silky beer with character produced by slight orangey notes.......

Absolutely fantastic!  Having never been to Cologne, I can't say if it is true to style, but this lightly fruity, top-fermented beer is pure joy to drink.  Soft, easy-going flavor and a light, refreshing body make this a new favorite of mine. Not to be missed.
A very worthy "summertime" brew!  Smooth and flavorful, just wish it had a little more bite---acidic or carbonation-wise.

Light and refreshing, (to coin a phrase).
Good balance of hops, clean finish.
Great for hot weather.
Nice balance of hops and a fruity malt with a less potent aftertaste than some other wheat beers. Very refreshing.
slightly hoppy aroma.  Pretty light malty taste.  Good for hot days like tonight.
I like it, one of my favorite hot afternoon brews. Nice balance, crisp and clean.

Very refreshing.  Nice light balance
between the hops and sweet malt to create
a very drinkable Kolsch beer.

What's this?  A non-incredibly hopped brew from Goose Island?  Definitely a different taste from their other lighter beers.  For the style, it has a good hop/malt mixture.  The nose is very clean and distinguished.  Not my favorite Kolsch, but I'm  enjoying it on a nice warm night.
A nice light summer beer. Hop/floral nose and a tad bit of hop bite at the end. Not a bad summer offering from GI.
Good light summer beer, not bitter like the Honker's Ale....................
This is the Ideal summertime beer full of flavor and refreshing it is very comparable to Samuel Adam's Summer Ale.
